to leave spaces between the desks
床板が透かしてある
There are spaces between the floor-boards.
(活字を組む時)行間を透かす
to space the lines
言葉と言葉の間を透かす
to space the words
文字と文字の間を透かす
to space the letters
行間を透かさない印刷
solid printing
木が透かして植えてある
The trees are planted at some intervals.
木を透かさないと生長が悪い
The trees must be thinned to grow well.
湖水は森を透かして見える
The lake shows through the wood―between the trees.

content: 2. (=透して見る) to look through (glass); to peer into (the darkness); to hold (anything) to the light

content.content: 太陽はくべたガラスを透かして見ると見える
You can look at the sun through smoked glass.
暗闇を透かして見ると二人の姿が見えた
I peered into the darkness, and saw two forms.
金箔を明かりに透かして見ると緑色に見える
Hold a gold-leaf to the light, and it looks green.

content:
すかす〔賺す〕
〈他動〉To coax; to cajole; to wheedle

content.content: 両親は娘をすかしてやっと納得さした
Her parents coaxed her into compliance―cajoled her into compliance.
おどしたりすかしたりしてやっと納得さした
What by threats, what by entreaties, they at last made her comply.
おどしてもすかしても白状しない
Neither threats nor entreaties can make him confess.

content:
ズカズカ
〈副〉Without ceremony; without leave; directly; plainly; bluntly

content.content: ズカズカ物言う男だ
He is plain-spoken―a blunt fellow.
彼はどこへでもズカズカ入って行く
He enters any house without ceremony―without leave.

content:
すがすがしい〔清々しい〕
〈形〉Refreshing

content.content: すがすがしい心地がする
I feel refreshed.

content:
すがた〔姿〕
〈名〉
1. A figure; a form

content.content: あの女は姿が好い
She has a good figure―a graceful figure.
目に立つ姿だ
She cuts a conspicuous figure.
引き立たない姿だ
She cuts an inconspicuous figure.
暗闇に透かして見ると二人の姿が見えた
I peered into the darkness, and saw two forms.
男と女の姿であった
They were the forms of a man and a woman.
姿を絵に写す
to represent a figure

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 音はすれども姿は見えぬ
I hear him, but I do not see him.
姿を現す、姿を見せる
to show oneself―appear―make one's appearance―put in an appearance
彼は近頃ちっとも姿を見せない
He has not shown himself of late.
今朝姿を見せた
He made his appearance this morning.
ちらりと姿を見た
I got a glimpse of him.
それっきり姿を見ない
That was the last I saw of him.
姿を消す、姿を隠す
to disappear (from view)―vanish (out of sight)―keep out of sight―keep close―lie low
掻き消すように姿を消した
It vanished where it stood.
ほとぼりの冷めるまで姿を隠したがよい
You had better keep out of sight till the storm blows over.
彼は当分姿を隠している
He keeps close―lies low―for the present.
姿を変える
to disguise oneself
彼は姿を変えている
He is in disguise.
女が男に姿を変える
A woman disguises herself as a man―dresses herself in male attire.
彼女は男に姿を変えている
She is disguised as a man―in male attire.
この元素はいろいろに姿を変える
This element appears under various forms.
彼は山伏に姿を変えて逃げた
He fled under the guise of an itinerant monk.
己が姿を鏡で見る
to look at oneself in the glass
後姿を見送る
to gaze after one

content: 2. (=人の状態)a condition; a plight

content.content: その姿を見て泣いた
I cried to see him in that condition.
このお姿におなり遊ばしたか
Do I behold you in this condition?
あさましい姿になったものだ
He is in a woeful plight―What a plight he is in!
この姿では人前へ出られない
I am not fit to be seen.
実に変わり果てた姿だ
He is the wreck of his former self―the ruin of what he was―the shadow of what he used to be.

content: 3. (=ありさま)a state

content.content: 孤立の姿
a state of isolation
彼は味方を皆失って孤立の姿だ
He has lost all his friends, and stands alone.
当節は毎晩徹夜の姿です
I sit up all night these days.
会社は気息奄々の姿だ
The firm is at its last gasp.
排日運動のため対支貿易は休止の姿である
Owing to the anti-Japanese movement, our China trade is at a standstill.

content:
すかない〔好かない〕
〈形〉Hateful; odious; horrid; detestable; disgusting

content.content: 好かない老翁だ
He is a horrid old man.
好かない奴だ
He is an odious fellow.

content:
すがめ〔眇〕
〈名〉
1. (=片目)a one-eyed person

content.content: あの人はすがめだ
He is blind of one eye.

content: 2. (=藪睨み)one who squints

content.content: あの人はすがめだ
He squints.

content:
すがりつく〔縋り付く〕
〈他動〉→『

content.content: すがる〔縋る〕
彼は今の地位にようやくすがりついている
He hangs on by the eyelids.

content:
すがる〔縋る〕
〈他動〉
1. To cling to (a rock); to hold on to (a rope); to hang on (one's neck); to lean on (one for support); to take hold of (a rope, etc.)

content.content: この綱にすがれ
Take hold of this rope!―Hold on to this rope!
一生懸命綱にすがった
I held on to the rope for dear life.
吊革にすがる
to hold on to a strap―hang on to a strap
女が男の首にすがって泣いた
She hung on his neck and cried.
海中に飛び込んで助けようと思った人が僕にすがって放さなかった
The drowning man clung to me―gripped me like a vice.
患者が看護婦の肩に縋って歩く
The patient leans on his nurse for support.
あの人は杖に縋って歩く
He leans on a staff.
袖にすがる
to hang on one's sleeve―(歎願するの意味なら)―entreat one to do something―(哀願するの意味なら)―appeal to one for mercy
女が夫の死骸に縋って泣いておった
She was crying over her husband's remains.

content: 2. (=頼む、頼る、歎願する)to depend on (others); to rely on (one's promise); to entreat, implore (one to do something); to look to (one) for assistance

content.content: 人にすがるものじゃない
You should not depend on others.
女が子どもを助けてくれといって僕に縋ってきた
She entreated me to help her child―implored me to save her child.
あなたにおすがり申すほかは有りません
I have no one but you to look to for assistance―You are the only friend to whom I can look for assistance.
彼は人にすがられるとすぐに助けてやる
He is ready to help any one who comes to him for assistance.
人の情けにすがる
to throw oneself on another's mercy
彼にすがられて十円やった
I listened to his entreaty and gave him ten yen.

content:
すかれる〔好かれる〕
〈被動〉To be liked (by some one); to be beloved (of all); to be popular (with some); to be a favourite (of or with some one)

content.content: あの人は誰にでも好かれる
He is beloved of all.
正直だから誰にでも好かれる
His honesty makes him beloved of all.
人に好かれる質だ
He is of an amiable disposition.
あの男は女に好かれる
He is a favourite with the ladies―a lady's man.
君は女に好かれるか
How do you get on with the ladies?
僕はとても女に好かれた柄じゃない
I am not made for female society.

すがれる〔闌れる〕
〈自動〉To wither; to fade

すかをくわす〔すかを食わす〕
〈他動〉To give (one) the slip

content:
すかんぴん〔素寒貧〕
〈形〉Penniless; impecunious

content.content: あの男はすかんぴんだ
He has not a penny in the world―not a penny to bless himself with.
僕はいつもすかんぴんだ
I am always impecunious.

すかんぽ〔酸模〕
〈名〉The dock; the sorrel

content:
すき〔隙〕
〈名〉
1. (=隙間) a crevice; an interstice; an aperture; a chink; a gap; an opening; a space; room

content.content: 歯に隙がある
There are gaps between the teeth.
隙の有る歯
a loose set of teeth
隙の無い歯
a close set of teeth
戸に隙がある
There are chinks in the door.
隙から風が入る
The wind blows in through the crevices―There is a draught.
隙から入る風
a draught
隙から煙が出る
Smoke issues forth at the apertures.
日光が雲の隙から漏る
The sun breaks through the clouds.
(教室の)机と机の間に隙がある
There are spaces between the desks.
まだ入る隙があるか
Is there room for more?
客がいっぱいでもう入る隙がありません
The house is full, and there is no room for more.
いま一人だけ入る隙があります
There is room for one more.
城は蟻の這い出る隙も無く囲まれた
The castle was closely besieged―tightly invested.
隙の無い囲み
a close siege
隙の無い群集
a dense crowd
隙の無い議論
a close argument

content: 2. (=手隙) leisure; spare time; time to spare

content.content: 僕は少しも隙が無い
I have no time to spare―not a minute that I can call my own.
手に隙が無い
My hands are full.
授業やら著述やらで手に少しも隙が無い
Between teaching and writing, my time is fully taken up.
この仕事が片づくといくらか隙ができる
When the work is off my hands, I shall have some time to spare.
仕事の隙を見て著述をやる
I write in the intervals of business.
間がな隙がな読書する
I read at odd moments.

content: 3. (=注意の隙、油断) unguardedness; an unguarded moment:(撃剣などなら) an unguarded point

content.content: 人の隙を窺う
to watch for an unguarded moment
相手の隙を狙え
Watch for a moment when your man is off his guard!
相手の隙に乗ずる
to take one off one's guard―take one unawares―take one at vantage―catch one napping
隙に乗ぜられた
I was taken off my guard―taken unawares―taken at vantage―caught napping.
彼は乗ずべき隙が無い
He is never taken off his guard―never off his guard―ever on his guard.
彼の構えは一分の隙も無い
He leaves not a point unguarded―He is completely guarded.
構えに隙がある
He leaves some points unguarded―He lays himself open to attack.
それでは隙だらけだ
You are open to attack at every point.
敵に隙を見せる
to leave an unguarded point―lay oneself open to attack
隙を見せぬ
to leave no point unguarded
隙を見て打ち込む
to deal one a blow at an unguarded point―break through one's guard
(人に)隙の有る処
one's blind side
誰でも隙が有る
Everybody has his blind side.
あの人は隙が無い
I don't know where to have him.
隙無く武装している
He is armed to the teeth.
彼の議論は五分の隙も無い
He is armed at all points.
隙の無い論法
close reasoning
彼は爪先まで隙の無い男だ
He is clever to the finger-tips―witty to the finger-nails.
彼の支度には五分の隙も無い
His dress is unimpeachable.
この子はいたずらで油断も隙もあったものじゃない
The child is so mischievous that I can't take my eyes off him for a moment.

content: 4. (=機会) a chance

content.content: 隙を見て行ってみよう
I will go when I have a chance.
隙を窺う、隙を狙う
to watch for a chance
彼は隙が有ったら逃げようとしている
He is watching for a chance to escape.
目配りが厳重で逃げる隙が無かった
So strict a watch was kept on him that he saw no chance of escape.

content:
すき〔好き〕
〈名〉
1. Liking; love; taste; fancy

content.content: 好きこそ物の上手なれ
What one likes, one will do well.
好きには身を砕く
Love spares no pains.

content: 2. (動詞に訳せば) to like; to love; to care for (anything); to be fond of (wine); to be keen on (sports); to have a liking for (a man); to have a love for (liquor); to have a fondness for (long words); to have a fancy for (gardening); to have a taste for (reading); to have an inclination for (study); to have a passion for (gambling); to have an appetite for (the marvellous); to have a relish for (sweets); to have a preference for (Japanese clothes); to have a weakness for (fine clothes); to delight in (novels); to take kindly to (one's books)

content.content: この子は独りで遊ぶことが好きだ
The child likes to play by itself.
あの男はどこか好きだ
I have a liking for that man.
あの人は酒が好きだ
He is fond of wine―He has an appetite for strong drink―He goes in for liquor.
酒が好きで止められない
He has an unconquerable love for drink.
僕は甘い物が好きだ
I have a relish for sweets―I am keen on sweets―I go in for sweets―I have a sweet tooth.
君は読書が好きか
Have you a taste for reading?
読書は三度の飯よりも好きだ
Books are meat and drink to me.
この子は学問が好きだ
The boy has an inclination for study―He takes kindly to his books.
英国人は勝負事が好きだ
The English have a passion for sporting.
彼は親父に似てばくちが好きだ
He has inherited his father's passion for gambling.
女流作家はむずかしい言葉を使うことが好きだ
Lady authors have a fondness for long words.
あの女は美服が好きだ
She is fond of fineries.
男のくせに美服が好きだ
He has a weakness for fine clothes.
僕の親父は庭いじりが好きだ
My father has a fancy for gardening.
あの人は書生の世話が好きだ
He takes interest in students.
僕は小説が大好きだ
I delight in novels.
僕は運動が大好きだ
I am keen on sports.
あの人は強い酒が大好きだ
He is death on brandy.
僕はこんなことが大好きだ
I am nuts on such things―Such things are nuts to me.
あの人は下衆張ったことが好きだ
He has vulgar tastes.
あの人は女好きだ、あの女は男好きだ
He is amorous―She is amorous.
僕は支那料理は好きでない
I don't care for Chinese food.
僕は西洋の音楽はあまり好きでない
I don't care much for foreign music.
僕は西洋の音楽よりも日本の音楽の方が好きだ
I like Japanese music better than foreign―I prefer Japanese to foreign music.
あの西洋人は日本の物が好きだ
He shows a preference for things Japanese.

content: 3. (=な) favourite (actor); congenial (work); (work) that one likes; (work) to one's taste; (style) to one's liking; (house) after one's fancy; (man) after one's heart

content.content: 君の好きな役者は誰か
Who is your favourite actor?
別に好きなのは無い
I have no particular favourite.
僕の好きな本は Goldsmith だ
Goldsmith is my favourite author.
僕の好きな慰みは銃猟だ
Shooting is my favourite pastime.
君の好きな学科は英語か数学か
Which is your favourite branch, English or mathematics?
あれは好きな人だ
He is a man to my liking.
実に好きな人だ
He is a man after my own heart.
何でも好きな本をお読みなさい
Read any book you like!
親父は僕に好きな専門を選べと申しました
My father says I may choose any profession I like.
どれでも好きなのをお取りなさい
You may take any one you like―take your choice―make your choice.
いつでも好きな時に来給え
Come at any time you like―whenever you like.
ここなら好きなくらい大きな家が建つ
Here you can build as large a house as you like.
これは僕の好きな仕事だ
This is my favourite pursuit―This is my congenial work―The work is to my taste―It is a labour of love.
書き物は僕の好きな仕事だ
Writing is the work to my taste―my congenial work―my delight.
好きな道楽をする
to indulge one's tastes
彼は金が有るから好きな道楽ができる
His wealth enables him to indulge his tastes.
好きな物に祟り無し
Taste is the best guide.
あれはあの女の好きな男だ
He is the man of her choice.
あれはあの男の好きな女だ
She is the lady of his heart.
好きな道
one's hobby
学問の好きな人
a lover of learning
彼は好きなことを言っている
He gives rein to his tongue.
好きなようにする
to do as one likes―do as one pleases―do as one chooses―have one's way―have one's own way―please oneself―suit oneself
君の好きなようにし給え
You may do as you please―act at your pleasure―have your own way―suit yourself.
子どもらには好きなようにさせておきます
I let my children have their own way―I indulge my children (in their wishes).
病人のことだから好きなようにさしてやれ
Humour the invalid!
人を好きなようにする(盲従させる)
to lead people by the nose
女が男を好きなようにする(丸め込む)
She twists him round her little finger―turns him round her little finger.
好きで
of one's own choice―of one's own accord―for the sake of something―for the love of something
二人は好きで夫婦になったのだ
They got married of their own choice.
あの女は好きであの人の処へ嫁に行ったのかしら
I wonder if she can have married such a man of her own choice.
彼は冐険が好きで船乗りになったのだ
He went to sea for the sake of adventures―for the love of adventures.
あの人は働くことが好きで働くのだ(勉強道楽)
He loves labour for its own sake―loves labour for itself―loves labour for labour's sake.
日本は戦争が好きで戦争をするのではない
Japan does not wage war for war's sake.
好きで行う徳でなければ真の徳でない
He alone has true virtue who practises virtue for virtue's sake.
好きになる
to come to like―get to like―grow to like―learn to like―anything
僕はどうしても数学が好きになれない
I can't get to like mathematics.
いまに好きになる
You will soon come to like it―grow to like it.
男と連れ添っていれば好きになる
When you are united, you will learn to love him.
僕はあの人が好きになった
I have taken a fancy to that man.

content:
すき〔鋤〕
〈名〉A spade

content.content: 鋤で掘る
to dig with a spade

content:
すき〔数寄〕
〈名〉Taste

content.content: 数寄をこらす
to indulge one's tastes
庭は数寄をこらしたものだ
The garden is tastefully laid out.
数寄をこらした庭
a tasteful garden
数寄をこらした家
a sumptuous house
数寄者
a man of taste―a virtuoso

content:
すき〔犂〕
〈名〉A plough

content.content: 犂で地を耕す
to plough the land
犂鋤取る
to follow the plough
犂の身
a ploughshare
犂の柄
a plough-tail

content:
スキー
〈名〉(物) a ski:(事) skiing

content.content: スキーで走る
to ski
スキーに行く
to go skiing
スキーで走る人
a ski-runner

content:
すぎ〔過ぎ〕
〈前置詞相当〉Past; after

content.content: もう十二時過ぎだ
It is past twelve.
十二時過ぎに帰った
I returned after twelve―It was past twelve when I returned.
十二時過ぎには電車が無い
There are no cars after twelve.
十二時十五分過ぎだ
It is a quarter past twelve.
昼過ぎ
afternoon
昼過ぎにいく
I will come in the afternoon.
帰りは二十日過ぎになる
I shall return after the 20th.
彼岸過ぎには涼しくなる
It will get cooler after the equinox.
彼は五十過ぎだ
He is past fifty―gone fifty―turned of fifty―on the shady side of fifty.

content: 〈接尾詞〉(形容詞に訳せば)excessive:(副詞に訳せば)to excess; too much; over

content.content: 食い過ぎ、飲み過ぎ
excessive eating―excessive drinking
彼は食い過ぎをしては身体をこわす
He makes himself ill by eating to excess―eating too much―overeating himself.
彼の病気は飲み過ぎからだ
His illness comes of excessive drinking―drinking to excess―drinking too much―overdrinking himself.

content:
すぎ〔杉〕
〈名〉The cryptomeria; the Japanese cedar

content.content: 杉林
a cryptomeria forest
杉森
a cedar grove
杉並木
an avenue of cryptomerias
杉垣
a cryptomeria hedge
杉板
a cedar board
杉箸
cedar chopsticks
杉葉
cryptomeria-needles
杉皮
cryptomeria-bark
屋根は杉皮葺き
The roof is thatched with cryptomeria-bark.

content:
ずき〔好き〕
〈接尾詞〉A lover (of something); -phile

content.content: 本好き
a lover of books―a bibliophile
酒好き
a lover of wine―a thirsty soul
女好き
a philogynist
芝居好き
a play-goer
あの人は運動好きだ
He is a lover of sports―a sporting man.

すきうつし〔透写し〕
〈名〉Tracing:(=する) to trace (a map, etc.)

すきがえし〔漉き返し〕
〈名〉Remade paper

すきかえす〔漉き返す〕
〈他動〉To remake (paper)

content:
すききらい〔好き嫌い〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: すきぎらい〔好き嫌い〕

content:
すきぎらい〔好き嫌い〕
〈名〉One's likes and dislikes:(=する) to be choice of (company, etc.)

content.content: 誰でも好き嫌いはある
Everybody has his likes and dislikes.
君のように好き嫌いをしては困る
You are hard to please―too fastidious.
あまり好き嫌いすると屑を取る
“Go farther and fare worse.”

すきぐし〔梳櫛〕
〈名〉A fine-toothed comb

すきこ〔梳子〕
〈名〉A women's hair-dresser's assistant

content:
すぎさる〔過ぎ去る〕
〈自動〉To pass away; to go by; to elapse

content.content: 過ぎ去った時
past time―bygone days
過ぎ去りしことは問わぬ
“Let bygones be bygones.”

すきしゃ〔好き者〕
〈名〉A sensualist; a satyr

すきしゃ〔数寄者〕
〈名〉A man of taste; a virtuoso

content:
すきずき〔好き好き〕
〈名〉A matter of taste

content.content: 色は好き好きだ
Colour is a matter of taste.
人は好き好き
Each man has his own taste―“Every man to his taste.”
蓼食う虫も好き好き
Tastes differ―“There is no accounting for tastes.”

content:
ずきずきする〔ズキズキする〕
〈自動〉To throb; to tingle

content.content: 頭がズキズキする
My head throbs.
傷口がズキズキする
The wound tingles with pain.

content:
ずきずきする〔ズキズキする〕
〈自動〉To throb; to tingle

content.content: 頭がズキズキする
My head throbs.
傷口がズキズキする
The wound tingles with pain.

content:
すきとおる〔透き通る〕
〈名〉To be transparent; to be diaphanous

content.content: ガラスは透き通る
Glass is transparent.
ガラスのように透き通る
It is transparent like glass.
透き通るような肌
a transparent complexion
透き通るような美人だ
She is a woman of clear complexion.
着物が薄くて肌が透き通って見える
The skin is seen through the thin garment.

content:
すぎなり〔杉形〕
〈名〉A cone:(=の) conical

content.content: 杉形に盛り上げる
to heap up in a cone

content:
すぎぬ〔過ぎぬ〕
〈副詞相当〉Only; merely; nothing but; no more than

content.content: 彼は一書生に過ぎない
He is nothing but a student―only a student―a mere student.
一片の形式に過ぎぬ
It is a mere matter of form.
誤解に過ぎぬ
It is only a misunderstanding.
口実に過ぎぬ
It is nothing but a pretence―only a pretext―a mere pretext.
それは風説に過ぎまい
It must be a mere rumour―It can be nothing but a rumour―It can be no more than a rumour.
これは一己の考に過ぎんです
This is merely my private opinion.

content:
すきはら〔空き腹〕
〈名〉An empty stomach

content.content: 空き腹に酒を飲む
to drink on an empty stomach
空き腹に飲むと酔う
Wine tells on an empty stomach.

content:
すきま〔隙間〕
〈名〉A crevice; an interstice; an aperture; a chink; a gap; an opening; a space

content.content: 歯に隙間がある
There are gaps between the teeth.
隙間のある歯
a loose set of teeth
隙間の無い歯
a close set of teeth
戸に隙間がある
There are chinks in the door.
隙間から風が入る
The wind blows in through the chinks―There is a draught.
隙間から入る風
a draught
隙間から煙が出る
Smoke issues forth at the apertures.
日光が雲の隙間から漏る
The sun breaks through the clouds.
(教室の)机と机との間に隙間がある
There are spaces between the desks.
城は蟻の這い出る隙間も無く囲まれた
The castle was closely besieged―tightly invested.
隙間の無い囲み
a close siege
隙間の無い群集
a dense crowd

すきまかぜ〔隙間風〕
〈名〉A draught

すきみ〔隙見〕
〈名〉Peeping:(一回なら) a peep:(=する) to peep (at or through a hole)

content:
すぎもの〔過ぎ物〕
〈名〉Something too good for one

content.content: あの細君はあの男には過ぎ物だ
She is too good for him―He is unworthy of her.

すきや〔透綾〕
〈名〉A kind of diaphanous silk

content:
すきやき〔透焼き、鋤焼〕
〈名〉Slices of meat or fish eaten while cooking in an iron pan

content.content: いっしょにすきやきを突ついた仲だ
We ate out of the same pan.

content:
すきやき〔透焼き、鋤焼〕
〈名〉Slices of meat or fish eaten while cooking in an iron pan

content.content: いっしょにすきやきを突ついた仲だ
We ate out of the same pan.

content:
すぎゆく〔過ぎ行く〕
〈自動〉To pass; to go by

content.content: 月日は過ぎ行く
Time passes―Time goes by.

content:
すぎる〔過ぎる〕
〈自動〉(=経過する)to pass; to elapse; to expire; to go on; to go by

content.content: 時が過ぎる
Time passes―Time elapses―Time expires―Time goes on―Time goes by.
二十年は夢のように過ぎた
Twenty years have passed like a dream.
春は過ぎた
Spring is past―Spring is over.
花は過ぎた
The blossoms are over.
月日は速かに過ぎる
Time flies.
時間が知らぬ間に過ぎた
Time slipped away―I took no note of time.
時が過ぎるに従って悲しみが薄らいだ
As time went by, my grief subsided―My grief subsided with the lapse of time―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Time blunted the edge of my sorrow.
彼は盛りが過ぎた
He is past his prime―He has seen his best days.
盛り過ぎたる姥桜{うばざくら}
She is past her prime―She is a superannuated beauty.
この手形は支払期限が過ぎている
The note is overdue.
三年過ぎてまた逢った
We met again three years after―three years later―after the lapse of three years―at the end of three years―at the expiration of three years.
過ぎたことはしかたがない
What is done, can not be helped―What is done, is done―“Let bygones be bygones.”

content:
〈他動〉
1. (=通過する)to pass (a door) ; to go past (a house) ; to pass through (a wood, etc.)

content.content: 門前を過ぎる
to pass one's door
汽車はいつしか福島を過ぎて仙台に着いた
We passed Fukushima before we knew, and arrived at Sendai.
この林を過ぎると河がある
When you pass through this forest, you come to a river.

content: 2. (=超過する)to exceed

content.content: 名は実に過ぎる
The name exceeds the reality.

content: 〈自他動〉(=過度にする)to go too far; to carry (the matter) too far; to go to excess; to carry (the matter) to excess; to be excessive; to overdo anything; to go beyond bounds:(副詞に訳せば)excessively; to excess; too much; too far

content.content: 過ぎたるは及ばざるが如し
“Too much is as bad as too little.”
物大に過ぐれば亡ぶ
Excessive size is self-destructive.
彼には過ぎた細君だ
She is too good for him―He is unworthy of her.
彼は身分に過ぎたぜいたくをする
He lives above his means.
これは身に過ぎた光栄です
This is undeserved honour―The honour is more than I deserve―The honour is above my deserts.

content: 〈接尾動詞〉(=過度にする)to go too far; to carry (the matter) too far; to go to excess; to carry (the matter) to excess; to be excessive; to overdo anything; to go beyond bounds:(副詞に訳せば)excessively; to excess; too much; too far

content.content: 食い過ぎる
to eat to excess―eat too much―overeat oneself
彼は食い過ぎては身体をこわす
He makes himself ill by overeating himself.
飲み過ぎる
to drink to excess―drink too much―overdrink oneself
ちと飲み過ぎた
I have taken a drop too much.
彼の病気は飲み過ぎるからだ
His illness comes of excessive drinking.
彼は飲み過ぎては病気する
He will drink himself ill.
彼の親父は飲み過ぎて死んだ
His father drank himself to death.
君は働き過ぎる、勉強し過ぎる
You work too hard―overwork yourself.
勉強し過ぎると病気になるぞ
You will work yourself ill.
勉強し過ぎると死ぬぞ
You will work yourself to death.
彼は勉強し過ぎて肺病になった
He has worked himself into consumption.
君は人の言うことを信じ過ぎる
You are too ready to believe―You are too credulous.
君は子どもを大事にし過ぎる
You make too much of your children.
彼は正直過ぎる
He is too honest―He carries his honesty to excess.
日本人はていねい過ぎると西洋人言う
Foreigners say that the Japanese are too polite―the Japanese carry their politeness too far.
多過ぎる
There are too many―more than are needed.
一つ多過ぎる
There is one too many―There are too many by one.
少なすぎる
There are too few―fewer than are necessary.
彼は気前が好過ぎる
He is too generous―generous to a fault―He carries his generosity too far.
まじめ過ぎる
He is too grave―grave to sadness.
心が優し過ぎる
He is too tender―tender to weakness.
惚れ過ぎる
to love too well―love to distraction
この子は利口過ぎる
The child is too knowing―The child knows too much.
お前はわがまま過ぎる
You are too self-indulgent.
君そりゃわがまま過ぎるぜ
That is too selfish of you.
彼は厳し過ぎる
He is too severe―He errs on the side of severity.
君は寛大過ぎる
You are too lenient―You err on the side of leniency.
話が善過ぎる
The news is too good to be true.
夫婦にしては年が違い過ぎる
Their ages differ too much―Their ages are too unequal―for them to be man and wife.
彼は年が行き過ぎている
He is too old―His age is against him.
年が若過ぎる
He is too young―His youth is against him.
あの女は作りが若過ぎる
She gets herself up too young.
彼は金が有り過ぎる
He has too much money―He has money in excess.
二人は仲が好過ぎる
They are too intimate―too familiar.
仲が好過ぎてけんかする
Overfamiliarity is the cause of their quarrels.
何事もいき過ぎぬようにせよ
You must not go beyond bounds―You must keep within bounds―in everything.
気が利き過ぎて間が抜けている
She is too knowing to be clever.

content: 〈打消動詞〉(過ぎぬ)→『

content.content: すぎぬ〔過ぎぬ〕

すぎわい〔生計〕
〈名〉A living; a livelihood

すく
〈他動〉(=網をすく)To make (a net)

content:
すく〔空く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=空になる) to become empty

content.content: 電車が空いている
The car is empty―not crowded.
腹が空く
to become hungry
お腹が空いた
(直訳すれば)My honourable inside is empty―(意訳すれば)―I am hungry.
ソーダ水を飲むと胸が空く
Soda-water relieves the chest.
手が空く
to become disengaged―become free
お手が空いていますか
Are you at leisure?
三十分経つと手が空きます
I shall be free―at leisure―at your service―in half an hour.
やっと手が空いた
I am at leisure now.

content: 2. (=明く) to become vacant

content.content: そのうちに席が空くだろう
Some seats will be vacant very soon.
一等が空いているか
Is there room in the first class?
二等が空いています
There is room in the second class.

content:
すく〔好く〕
〈他動〉To like; to love; to care for (anything)

content.content: 僕は支那料理は好かぬ
I don't care for Chinese food.
西洋の音楽はあまり好かぬ
I don't care much for foreign music.
好かない奴だ
He is an odious fellow.
いけ好かない老翁だ
He is a horrid old man.
あの人は虫が好かぬ
I have an antipathy to that man.
好いたお方
the man I love―the man of my choice
好いた女
the girl I love―the lady of my heart
二人は好いた同志だ
They are lovers.
好いた同志の縁
a love-match
あの人は誰にでも好かれる
He is beloved of all.
あっさりしているから誰にでも好かれる
His frankness makes him beloved of all.
人に好かれる質だ
He is of an amiable disposition.
あの人は女に好かれる
He is a favourite with the ladies―a lady's man.
君は女に好かれるか
How do you get on with the ladies?
僕はとても女に好かれた柄じゃない
I am not made for female society.
いやで幸い好かれちゃ困る
I am glad you don't love me,
お気の毒だが外に有る
For true to another I must be.

すく〔漉く〕
〈他動〉(=紙を漉く)To make, manufacture (paper)

content:
すく〔透く〕
〈自動〉
1. (=透き通る) to be transparent; to be seen through

content.content: 家の中が垣根から透いて見える
The interior of the house can be seen through the fence.
あの人は透いて見えるような嘘をつく
He tells transparent lies―thin lies.
底が透いて見える
That's too thin.

content: 2. (=隙間がある) to leave a gap; to leave an opening

content.content: 歯が透いている
There are gaps between the teeth―The teeth are loose.
君は前歯が透いている
There are gaps between your front teeth―You have loose front teeth.
砲弾が破裂して隊伍が透いた
A shell bursting left a gap in the ranks.
壁が透いていると見えて寒い風が入る
There must be some opening in the wall, for there is a cold draught.

content: 3. (=まばらになる) to become sparse; to become thin

content.content: この辺は木が透いている
The trees are thinner here.

すく〔梳く〕
〈他動〉(=髪を梳く)To comb (the hair)

すく〔犁く〕
〈他動〉(=畠を犁く)To plough (the fields)

content:
すぐ〔過ぐ〕
〈他動〉To exceed

content.content: 名は実に過ぐ
The fame exceeds the reality―The reality falls short of the fame.

content:
すぐ〔直ぐ〕
〈副〉At once ; directly; immediately; instantly; this instant; on the instant; in an instant; in a moment; in a second; in a minute; in a trice; in a jiffy; in a flash; in no time; at a moment's notice; straight; straight off:(米国にては)right off; right away

content.content: すぐ来い
Come at once!―Come this instant!
すぐ行く
I am coming directly―I will be there in a minute.
その足ですぐ学校へ行った
I went straight to the school.
急に思い立ってすぐに立って来た
I suddenly thought of coming, and started on the instant.
すぐ行ってすぐ帰って来る
I will be there in a trice, and be back in a jiffy.
すぐにやってしまおう
I will get it done in no time.
いざという時すぐに間に合う
It can be ready at a moment's notice.
大金のことですから今すぐというわけには参りません
I can not have such a large sum ready at a moment's notice.
すぐにお返事はできかねます
I can not give you an immediate answer.
なにかすぐに金になる仕事がしたい
I wish to do something that can be turned to immediate account.
朝起きたらすぐにこの薬をお上がりさい
Take this medicine the first thing in the morning!

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: そんな大金を今すぐに払えとは無理だ
You can not expect me to pay down such a large sum of money.
彼はすぐに人の言うことを信ずる
He is too ready to believe―too credulous.
誰にでもすぐわかることだ
It is obvious to the dullest understanding.
帽章を見れば何学校だかすぐわかる
You can see at a glance what school one belongs to by the badge on the cap.
ガラスはすぐこわれる
Glass is apt to break―Glass breaks easily.
あの人はすぐ怒る
He gets angry on the least provocation―He is quick to take offence.
すぐ反り身になって気取る
He bridles up on the least provocation.
すぐ目の前にある物が見えない
One can not see what is right under one's eyes―under one's very nose.
この子はすぐ覚える
The child is quick at learning.
この戸を開けるとすぐ通りだ
This door opens on the street.

content: 〈接続詞〉As soon as; directly; the moment; the instant

content.content: 朝起きたらすぐこの薬をお上がりなさい
Take the medicine as soon as you get up.
彼は僕の姿を見るとすぐ逃げ出した
He ran off the moment he saw me.
その報に接するとすぐ出発した
I started directly I heard the news.
できたらすぐ届けます
I will send it home as soon as it is ready.
船酔いは地を踏むとすぐ治る
You feel well the instant you set foot on land.
彼は卒業するとすぐ洋行した
He went abroad as soon as he graduated―immediately upon his graduation.
僕は枕を付けるとすぐ眠る
I fall asleep as soon as I lie down―the moment I lie down.

content:
すくい〔救い〕
〈名〉
1. (=救助) help; aid; rescue; relief

content.content: 叫んで救いを求める
to cry for help
救いにおもむく
to go to one's aid―go to one's rescue

content: 2. (=救世) salvation

content.content: 救いの道
salvation―redemption
救い主
a saviour―a redeemer

content:
すくいあげる〔救い上げる〕
〈他動〉To bring (one) to land

content.content: 河へ飛び込んで子どもを救い上げた
I plunged into the river, and brought the drowning child safe to land.

すくいあみ〔掬い網〕
〈名〉A scoop-net; a dip-net

content:
すくいだす〔救い出す〕
〈他動〉To help (one) out; to deliver (one from or out of danger); to rescue (one from the flames, etc.)

content.content: 人を困難から救い出す
to help one out of difficulties
人を危険より救い出す
to deliver one out of danger
猛火の中へ飛び込んで女を救い出した
I plunged into the fire and rescued the woman from the flames.

すくいとる〔掬い取る〕
〈他動〉To scoop up; to dip up

すくいぬし〔救い主〕
〈名〉A saviour; a redeemer

すくいまい〔救い米〕
〈名〉Rice given in charity; charity-rice

content:
すくう〔掬う〕
〈他動〉To scoop; to dip

content.content: 網で魚を掬う
to scoop fish with a net―catch fish with a net―net fish
手で水を掬い上げる
to dip up water with one's hands
手で水を掬って飲む
to drink water out of one's hands
杓子で汁を掬う
to ladle soup
匙で汁を掬う
to spoon up soup
人の足を掬う
to trip one up

content:
すくう〔救う〕
〈他動〉To save (one's life―one from death or ruin); to rescue (one from drowning); to deliver (one from danger); to redeem (man from sin and damnation); to release (one from distress or trouble); to relieve (one of distress or trouble); to help (one out of difficulties); to relieve, succour, help (the poor); to pick up (a shipwrecked crew)

content.content: 人命を救う
to save a man's life―save one from death
人の滅亡を救う
to save one from ruin
霊魂を救う
to save a soul
海へ飛び込んで溺死する人を救った
I plunged into the sea, and rescued a man from drowning.
猛火の中へ飛び込んで女を救った
I plunged into the fire, and rescued a woman from the flames.
河へ飛び込んで子どもを救い上げた
I plunged into the river, and brought the child safe to land.
人の危難を救う
to deliver man from danger
人の困難を救う
to relieve one of distress―release one from trouble―help one out of difficulties
貧民を救う
to relieve the poor―help the poor―succour the poor―give relief to the poor
乞食を救う
to take a boy out of the gutter
醜業婦を救う
to take a girl off the streets
世を救う
to save the world―redeem the world―(from sin and damnation)
国家の急を救う
to meet an emergency
君に救われなけれゃ僕は死ぬのであった
But for your rescue,―But for your help,―I should have been drowned.
僕は危ないところを救われた
I was delivered from an imminent danger―snatched from the jaws of death.
誰も救いに来てくれぬ
Nobody will come to my rescue.
あの人に命を救われたことがある
He once saved my life―I owe him my life.
病人を救うべからず
He is past cure―past help of man―He is a gone case―It is all over with―all up with―the invalid.
国を憂うるはやすく国を救うは難し
It is easy to prophesy evil, but hard to avert it.

すくう〔巣喰う〕
〈自動〉To build (a nest)

content:
すぐさま〔直様〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: すぐ〔直ぐ〕

content:
すくせ〔宿世〕
〈名〉One's precious state of existence

content.content: 宿世の因縁
karma―fate
宿世の縁と諦める
to resign oneself to one's fate

content:
ずくで
〈接尾詞〉By dint of; out of; for the sake of; from motives of

content.content: 彼は勉強ずくで成功したのだ
He succeeded by dint of close application.
あの相撲は力ずくで勝つのだ
He wins by sheer strength.
二人は相談ずくで別れた
They separated by common consent.
親切ずくで世話をしてやったのだ
I helped him out of kindness.
彼は意地ずくで強情張っているのだ
He persists in his course out of spite.
あの女は慾得ずくで仕えているのではない
She does not serve him from selfish motives.
慾得ずくで引き受けた仕事じゃない
The work was not undertaken for the sake of gain.
慾得ずくの結婚
a marriage dictated by interest―an interested marriage
金銭ずくで済むことならいくらでも出す
If money will do the business, I will go any length.
金ずくにも何ずくにも品が無い
The article is not to be had for love or money.
腕ずくで取って見せる
I will take it by force.
義理ずくで世話をしているのだ
I help him as a matter of duty.

content:
すくない〔少い〕
〈形〉
1. (=数が少ない) few

content.content: 人数が少ない
There are few men.
このことのできる人は少ない
Few men can do this.
このことのできない人は少ない
There are few men who can not do this.
百まで生きる人は少ない
Few people live, to be a hundred.
七十まで生きる人は少なくない
Those who live to be seventy are not few.
十代で結婚する者は少なくなった
Few people now marry while in their teens.
出席者は少なかった
Few people attended―The attendance was small.
火事が少なくなった
Fires have become less frequent.
あの学校は生徒が少なくなった
The students of that school have decreased―fallen off.
会員が少なくなった
The members have decreased―The membership has dwindled.

content: 2. (=量が少ない) little

content.content: 今年は雨が少ない
We have little rain this year.
彼は収入が少ない
He earns little―He has a small income.
彼は収入が少ないながらも貯蓄する
He saves the little that he earns―what little he earns.
全快の見込みは少ないもんだ
There is little hope of his recovery.
儲け少なく子だくさん
He has little to get and many to feed.
これは少ないがお前にやる
Here is something for you.

content: 3. (=稀) rare; rarely to be met with; few and far between

content.content: あのような学者は少ない
Such scholars are rare―rarely to be met with.
そんな果報は少ない
Such angel-visits are few and far between.

content: 4. (=払底) scarce

content.content: こんな品は少ない
Such articles are scarce.

content: 5. (=乏しい) scanty

content.content: 彼は給料が少ない
He has scanty pay―a small salary.

content: 6. (=不足) wanting; short of (hands, etc.)

content.content: 一冊少ない
One volume is wanting.
手が少なくて困っている
We are short of hands―suffering from shortage of hands.
水が少なくて困っている
We are short of water―suffering from shortage of water―suffering from water-famine.
その頃は小銭が少なかった
Then there was a shortage of small change.

content: 〈副〉(=めったに無い) seldom; rarely

content.content: あの人は出かけることが少ない
He seldom goes out.
本を開くことが少ない
He rarely opens a book.

content:
すくなからず〔少からず〕
〈形〉(数なら) not a few:(量なら) not a little; no little

content.content: 彼は少なからず著書がある
He has not a few writings.
僕は少なからず利益を得た
I have derived not a little benefit―no little benefit.

content: 〈副〉Not a little

content.content: 少なからず当惑した
I was not a little puzzled.

content:
すくなくとも〔少くとも〕
〈副〉At least; to say the least of it

content.content: 少なくとも一万円の値打は有る
It is worth, at least, 100,000 yen―worth 10,000 yen at the very least.
罪悪とは言えなくとも少なくとも悪習とは言える
It may not be a sin, but it is a vice, to say the least of it.

content:
すくむ〔竦む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=恐れて小さくなる) to crouch; to cower

content.content: 彼は隅っこにすくんでいる
He is crouching in a corner―crouched in a corner.
彼は一日我が家にすくんでいる
He cowers at home all day.

content: 2. (=動けない) to be cramped

content.content: 足がすくんで歩けない
My legs are cramped, and I can not walk.

content:
ずくめ
〈副〉Entirely; all through

content.content: 彼はなにもかも金銀ずくめだ
He is surrounded by gold and silver.
彼はなにもかも絹物ずくめだ
He is lapped in silk.

content:
すくめる〔竦める〕
〈他動〉To duck (one's head); to shrug (one's shoulders)

content.content: 首をすくめる
to duck one's head―shrug one's shoulders
銃弾がヒューと来ると知らず知らず首をすくめる
When a bullet whistles past, you duck your head in spite of yourself.
身をすくめる
to shrink (for fear)

content:
すぐる〔選る〕
〈他動〉To select; to choose; to pick out, sort out, cull out (the best)

content.content: 選りに選る
to pick and choose
選りに選った
picked―select―choice
選りに選った人々だ
They are picked men―the pick of the men.

content:
すぐれた〔勝れた〕
〈形〉Excellent; superior

content.content: 勝れた学者だ
He is an excellent scholar―an eminent scholar.
腕前の勝れた人だ
He is a man of superior ability―a man of uncommon ability.

content:
すぐれぬ〔勝れぬ〕
〈打消動詞〉To be out of sorts

content.content: からだが勝れぬ
I am out of sorts―in poor health.
今日は気分が勝れぬ
I feel out of sorts today.

content:
すぐれる〔勝れる〕
〈自他動〉
1. To excel(in anything); to surpass(the other in some respect); to be superior(to the other in some respect); to have advantages(over the other in some respect)

content.content: 彼は学問が勝れている
He excels in scholarship―He is an excellent scholar.
彼は学力では君に勝れている
He is your superior in ability.
彼は種々の点において僕よりも勝れている
He is my superior in several respects―He has several advantages over me.
彼は人並み勝れている(衆に勝る)
He surpasses most men―He is above the common run―He is out of the common.
あの女は人並み勝れた器量だ
She is beautiful above the run of women―beautiful beyond the common lot―She is of surpassing beauty―of singular beauty―of rare beauty.
人勝み勝れて学問ができる(学力衆に勝る)
His attainments are something out of the common―His scholarship is above the common run―He is an eminent scholar.
力量衆に勝る
He has a strength beyond most men―He has a Herculean strength.
勝徳衆に勝る
He is good and happy beyond the lot of many.
すぐれぬ〔勝れぬ〕

content:
すげ〔菅〕
〈名〉The sedge

content.content: 菅の笠
a sedge-hat

content:
すけだち〔助太刀〕
〈名〉Assistance in a fight:(人は) a second:(=する) to assist (one) in a fight; to act as second (to one)

content.content: 危なかったら助太刀に行く
When you are in danger, I will come to your rescue.

content:
スケッチ
〈名〉A sketch:(=する) to sketch; to make a sketch of (anything)

content.content: スケッチに行く
to go sketching
スケッチ帖
a sketch-book

content:
スケート
〈名〉(氷り滑靴) (a pair of) skates:(氷滑り) stating:(=する) to skate

content.content: 諏訪湖へ行ってスケートをやった
I skated―I had some skating―on Lake Suwa.
ローラースケート
roller-skates
屋内スケート場
a rink―a skating-rink

content:
すけない〔少い〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: すくない〔少い〕

content:
すげない〔素気ない〕
〈形〉Cold, icy, frigid, freezing (manners) ; curt, short (answer) ; square, flat, point-blank (refusal)

content.content: あの人はすげないふうをしている
He has cold manners―icy manners―frigid manners.
何を問われてもすげない返事をする
He returns a curt answer―a short answer―to every question.
女が男にすげなくした
She was short with him―She gave him the cold shoulder.
すげなく断るわけにもいかぬ
I could not refuse flatly―refuse point-blank.
すげなく断られた
I was met by a flat refusal―a square refusal.

content:
すけべい〔助平〕
〈形〉Lewd; prurient; incontinent; lecherous; lustful; lascivious; licentious; sensual; wanton; goatish

content.content: 助平な奴だ
He is a satyr―(女なら)―She is hot stuff.

content:
すけべいこんじょう〔助平根性〕
〈名〉Selfish motives

content.content: 助平根性を出す
to act from selfish motives

content:
すける〔助ける〕
〈自他動〉To help (one do something); to aid, assist (one in doing something); to lend (one) a hand→『

content.content: たすけ〔助け〕
ちょっと助けてくれ
Just lend me a hand!
荷物を運んで助けろ
Help me carry the luggage!
本を運んで助けよう
I will help (you) carry the books.
座敷を片づけて助けよう
I will help you put the room to rights.
親類に不幸があって娘が助けに行きました
A relation has had a loss, and she has gone to help them.
助けに来てくれ
Come and help me!
(僕には食いきれないから)食って助けろ
Will you help me finish it?

content:
すげる
〈他動〉To put in

content.content: 下駄の鼻緒をすげる
to fit a clog with cords
煙管{きせる}の羅宇{らう}をすげる
to mend the bamboo-stem of a pipe

content:
すごい〔凄い〕
〈形〉Ominous (calm); grim(silence); ghastly(face); unearthly(voice); weird(beauty); eerie(occurrence); uncanny(event); sinister(countenance); lurid(flashes); dismal(place); dreary(scene); wild(look); appalling(sight); terrific(roar); sublime(thunderstorm, etc.)

content.content: 凄い顔をしている
She has a ghastly face―a wild look.
彼は酒に酔うと凄い目で人をにらむ
When he gets drink, he will glare at you with wild eyes.
凄い笑い顔だ
It is a ghastly smile―a grim smile.
凄い笑い声を出す
She laughs a hysterical laugh.
狂人の笑い声は凄い
A madman laughs an unearthly laugh.
凄い光景だ
It is a weird spectacle―an appalling sight―a dreary scene.
焼け跡は凄い光景だ
The fire has left a dreary scene.
月が焼け跡に凄く光を投げていた
The moon threw a weird light on the scene of the late fire.
凄いばくち
deep gaming
凄いばくちを打つ
They play deep―play for high stakes.
凄い腕前
unearthly skill―astute ability―shrewdness―artfulness
あの女は腕が凄い
She is a shrewd woman―an artful woman.
凄いような美人だ
She is a sublime beauty―a cold beauty.
凄かったぜ
It was sublime!
凄い文句を並べる
to intimidate one with threats
暴風雨が起きる前には凄いほど静まり返る
An ominous silence precedes a storm.
黒煙の中に凄い閃きが見える
Within the black smoke appear lurid flashes.

content:
すごうで〔凄腕〕
〈名〉Unearthly skill; astute ability; astuteness; shrewdness; sharpness

content.content: あの女は凄腕だ
She is a shrewd woman―a sharp woman―a crafty woman―a designing woman.

content:
すこし〔少し〕
〈名、形、副〉
1. ［数］A few; some

content.content: 本は少しはある
There are a few books.
少ししか無い
There are only a few―but few.
この本に誤植が少しある
There are some misprints in this book.
少しずつ持って来い
Bring a few at a time.

content: 2. ［量］A little; a bit; some

content.content: 金は少しはある
There is a little money.
少ししか無い
There is only a little―but little.
もう少しある
There is a little more.
金が少し要る
I want some money.
金が少しになった
Money is running low.
水にブランデーを少し注いで下さい
Give me some water with a dash of brandy in it.
少しずつ
a little at a time―little by little―bit by bit
毎日少しずつ学ぶよりほかは無い
There is nothing for it but to learn little by little every day.
あの人はなんでも少しずつ心得ている
He knows a little of everything―a bit of everything.
工事が少しずつ進む
The works progress inch by inch―by inches.
ほんの少し
just a little bit

content: 3. ［程度］A little; a bit; something; somewhat; slightly; rather; any?

content.content: ご病人は少しはお快い方ですか
Is the invalid any better?
少し快い方です
He is a little better―somewhat better―rather better.
少し悪い方だ
He is rather worse―worse, if anything―slightly worse.
値段が少し高い
The price is rather high.
彼は少しは学問ができるか
Is he anything of a scholar?
少しはできる
He is something of a scholar―a bit of a scholar.
少しは詩も作る
He is something of a poet―a bit of a poet.
絵も少し書く
He is something of a painter―a bit of a painter.
音楽も少しはやる
He is something of a musician―a bit of a musician.
なんでも少しずつやる
He is bit of everything.
少し豪傑肌が有る
He has a dash of the Bohemian in his composition.
少し慢心の気味が有る
He shows a dash of conceit.
少し発狂の気味が有る
He has a touch of insanity.
少し風邪の気味だ
I have a touch of cold.
彼は少し立腹の気味で答えた
He replied with a shade of offence in his tone.
少し青味を帯びている
It has a tinge of blue.
この手術は少し危険がある
The operation is attended with some danger.
少し心配になってきた
I am getting somewhat anxious.
少し驚いて彼の顔を見た
I looked in his face in some surprise.
君は少しむずかしいと質問に来る
You come to me whenever you meet with any difficulty.
少し考えてご覧
Consider a little!
少しお話したいことがある
I wish to have some talk with you.
少しは僕の胸中を察してくれ給え
You might have some consideration for my feelings.
彼は少しのことで立腹する
He takes offence at trifles.
少しのことで人を打つ
He will strike you on the least provocation.
弾が少しのことで頭をそれた
The bullet missed my head by a hair's breadth.
少しのことで汽車に乗り後れた
I missed the train by a second.
少しのことで彼に逢わなかった
I just missed meeting him.
いま少しで遅刻するところだった
I came never being late.
も少しで死ぬところだった
I came near dying―I very nearly died.

content: 4. ［時間］A little while; a moment

content.content: 少し待ってくれ
Wait a moment!―Wait a bit!
少しの間
for a while―for a little while
少しの間ここに居る
I shall stay here for a while.
少し前のことだった
It happened a little while ago.
少し経てば
in a while―in a little while
少し経てば花が咲く
The blossoms will be out in a while―in a few days.
少し経って
after a while―a little while after
彼は少し経って帰って来た
He returned after a while.
もう少ししてまたおいでなさい
Come again a little later on!
英語は少しやらずにいると下手になる
If you neglect for a little while your practice of English, you get out of practice.
まだ少し早過ぎる
It is a little too early.
(病人に向かって)起きるにはまだ少し早かろう
You are hardly well enough to rise.
少しでも早い方が好い
The sooner, the better.

content: 5. ［距離］A little way; a short distance

content.content: 線路伝いに少し行くと橋がある
If you go a little way along the track, you will find a bridge.
その家はもう少し先だ
The house is a little way farther on.
旅順攻撃は少しずつ進んだ
The attack on Port Arthur advanced inch by inch―by inches.

content:
すこしく〔少しく〕
〈副〉A little; somewhat; something; slightly; rather

content.content: 病人は少しく快い方です
He is a little better―somewhat better―rather better.
少しく悪い方です
He is rather worse―slightly worse―worse, if anything.
意味が少しく曖昧だ
The meaning is somewhat ambiguous.
これはあれより少しく好い
This is something better than that.

content:
すこしも〔少しも〕
〈副〉Not (in) the least; not the slightest; not at all; none whatever; nothing; no whit, not a whit, never a whit; not a bit of it

content.content: 僕はそんなことは少しも知らない
I have no idea of the matter―not the faintest idea of the matter―not the slightest knowledge of the matter.
彼は少しも恐れる気色がない
He does not show the least sign of fear.
少しも恥じる様子が無い
He seems not in the least abashed.
見込みは少しも無い
There is no hope at all―no chance whatever.
近頃彼に少しも会わない
I have seen nothing of him lately.
少しも屈せず彼は再挙を図った
Nothing daunted, he prepared himself for another trial.
(疲れたかと問われて)いえ少しも
Not a bit of it.［注意］以下はこれに倣って作る言葉遣い。
雨が少しも降らぬ
Not a drop of rain falls.
風が少しも無い
There is not a breath of air.
病人は食物が少しも喉を通らぬ
He does not taste a morsel of food.
彼は少しも酒を飲まない
He does not drink a drop of wine.
昨夜は少しも眠らなかった
I did not get a wink of sleep last night.
少しも疑いが無い
There is not a shadow of doubt―not the shadow of a doubt―about it.
彼に勝てる見込が少しも無い
I have not the ghost of a chance against him.
彼はこっけいなどは少しも無い
He has not a spice of humour.
両人間に悪感情は少しも無い
There is not a trace of ill-feeling between the two.
彼は少しも英語を知らぬ
He does not know a word of English.
戦争をする口実は少しも無かった
There is not a shadow of pretext for war.
そんなことは少しもかまわぬ
I don't care a straw about it.
その説には少しも真実な事が無い
The statement does not contain a fraction of truth.
先方の要求を少しも引かぬ
He will not bate a jot of his demands.
彼は良心などは少しも無い
He has not a spark of conscience.
少しも証拠が無い
There is not a shred of evidence―not a rag of evidence.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 彼の来そうな様子が少しも無い
There is no sign of his coming.
これはあれに比べて少しも劣らぬ
This is nowise inferior to that―This is every bit as good as that.
僕は少しもこの辺の勝手を知らない
I am quite a stranger in these parts.

content:
すごす〔過ごす〕
〈他動〉
1. (=時を過ごす)to pass(time); to spend(time)

content.content: 読書に時を過ごす
I spend my time in reading.
心配な一夜を過ごした
I passed an anxious night.
空しく時を過ごす
to pass one's time in idleness―idle one's time away―waste time―live to no purpose
三年の月日を空しく過ごした
Three years have been passed in vain.
蚊帳が無くては夏が過ごされぬ
I can not pass the summer without a mosquito-net.
度を過ごす
to go too far―go to excess―go beyond bounds―overdo anything
何事も度を過ごさぬよう
You must not go beyond bounds―You must keep within bounds―in everything.
酒を過ごす
to drink too much―drink to excess―overdrink oneself
ちと酒を過ごした
I have taken a drop too much.
金を使い過ごした
I have spent too much money―I have been extravagant.
彼は金を使い過ごしてはいつも困っている
His extravagance always gets him into difficulties.
口を過ごす
to live―keep one
二人口は過ごせるが一人口は過ごせぬ
It costs less to keep two than one―It costs more to keep one than two.

content:
すごすご〔悄々〕
〈副〉Sorrowfully; sadly; mournfully; pensively; disconsolately; dejectedly; crest-fallen; forlorn; with a heavy heart; in a melancholy mood; with a pensive air

content.content: けんかに負けてすごすご帰って来た
Worsted in a quarrel, he returned crest-fallen.
すごすごと葬式に付いた
We followed his remains in sorrow to the grave.
彼はすごすごと故郷を離れた
He left his beloved home behind him with a heavy heart.
すごすごと我が家を出た
I left my home in a melancholy mood.
彼はすごすごと帰って行った
He took his leave with a pensive air.
女がすごすごと川端に立っていた
She stood forlorn on the bank of the river.

スコッチ
〈名〉Scotch:(羅紗なら) tweed

content:
すこっとらんど〔蘇格蘭<スコットランド>〕
〈固名〉Scotland:(=の) scotch

content.content: スコットランド人
a Scotchman―a Scot―(総称すれば)―the Scotch

content:
すこっとらんど〔蘇格蘭<スコットランド>〕
〈固名〉Scotland:(=の) scotch

content.content: スコットランド人
a Scotchman―a Scot―(総称すれば)―the Scotch

content:
すこぶる〔頗る〕
〈副〉Very; most

content.content: これはすこぶる興味ある問題である
This is a very interesting subject.
すこぶる美人だ
She is a most beautiful woman.
品はすこぶる上等
The article is of tiptop quality.
すこぶる面白いわけじゃないか
It is not at all bad.
彼のやり口はすこぶる振るっている
His procedure is most energetic.
そうしたらすこぶる妙だ
That would be superlatively good.
意匠はすこぶるこっている
The design is most elaborate.
敵は防戦すこぶる力む
The enemy made a gallant defence.

content:
すごみ〔凄味〕
〈名〉Ominousness; grimness; ghastliness; weirdness; a sinister look; a determined air

content.content: あの男は凄味が有る
He has a sinister look―He is sinister-looking―He is a dangerous man.
目に凄味が有る
He has a sinister look in his eyes.
その男が玄関に坐り込んだ時は凄味が有った
He sat down at the entrance with a determined air.

content:
すごもり〔巣籠り〕
〈名〉Nesting

content.content: 鶴の巣ごもり
the nesting crane

すごもる〔巣籠る〕
〈自動〉To nest

content:
すこやか〔健か〕
〈形〉Healthy; robust; hale and hearty; safe and sound

content.content: 子どもは虫気も無く健かに育った
The child grew up in perfect health.

すごろく〔双六〕
〈名〉A kind of backgammon

content:
すさび〔遊び〕
〈名〉Amusement; diversion; recreation; pastime

content.content: 筆のすさび
literary pursuits

content:
すさぶ〔荒ぶ〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: すさむ〔荒む〕

content:
すさまじい〔凄じい〕
〈形〉
1. Terrific (crash); tremendous (explosion); stupendous (force); terrible (force); appalling (scene); sublime (enthusiasm, etc.)

content.content: 家は凄まじい音響を立てて倒れた
The house fell with a terrific crash.
凄まじい音響を立てて爆発した
There was a tremendous explosion.
猛火は凄まじい勢いで蔓延した
The conflagration spread with terrible force.
凄まじい光景だった
It was an appalling sight.
彼の意気込みが凄まじい
His enthusiasm is sublime.
凄まじい勢いで進む
It rushes with tremendous force―with stupendous force.
文学もすさまじいや
Literature, indeed!

content:
すさむ〔荒む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=つのる)to grow in violence

content.content: 風が吹きすさむ
It blows hard.
暴風が吹きすさむ
The storm rages.

content:
2. (=荒れる)to become waste
3. (=衰える)to decline
4. (=耽る)to indulge (in anything); to addict oneself (to anything)

ずさん〔杜撰〕
〈形〉→『

content.content: ずざん〔杜撰〕

content:
ずざん〔杜撰〕
〈形〉Careless; slovenly; slipshod

content.content: 極めて杜撰な作だ
It is a slovenly work―a slipshod work.

content:
すし〔鮨〕
〈名〉A kind of rice sandwich→『

content.content: すしづめ〔鮨詰め〕

content:
すじ〔筋〕
〈名〉
1. (=筋肉) a muscle

content.content: 彼は顔の筋一つ動かさない(びくともせぬ)
He does not move a muscle of his face.

content: 2. (=青筋) a vein

content.content: あの人は怒ると額に筋を立てる
When he gets angry, veins stand out―his veins stand like whipcords―on his forehead.

content: 3. (=腱) a sinew; a tendon

content.content: その筋が張っている
That tendon is stiff.
筋をもんでくれ
Shampoo the tendons.
筋が詰まる、筋がつる
to be cramped―have the cramp
筋張った腕
a sinewy arm―a brawny arm

content: 4. (=動植物の繊維) a fibre; a string

content.content: さや豌豆の筋を取る
to string green peas
筋の多い芋
stringy potatoes
筋の多い肉
scraggy meat

content: 5. (=線) a line

content.content: 筋を引く
to draw a line
手の筋
the lines of the palm
手の筋を見る
to tell fortunes by the lines of one's palm―read one's hand―practise palmistry
お手の筋
You have guessed right―hit it―hit the nail on the head.
一筋道

筋を立てる(曲ったことを真直にする)
to right a wrong―right one's wrongs

素性を調べる、素性を洗う

content: 2. (=起原) origin

content:
5.

content:
すすむ〔進む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=前進する)to advance; to proceed (on one's way); to move forward; to move on; to make one's way

content.content: 前へ進め
Go ahead!―Forward!―March!
もっと前へお進みなさい
Please move forward!―draw nearer!
一歩前へ進む
to take a step forward
一歩進むごとに水が深くなる
The water grows deeper at every step.
君の方が僕より一歩進んでいる
You are a step ahead of me.
僕は一歩進んでこの方法を採用しようと思う
I will go a step further, and adopt the method.
一歩進んでこの方法の安全なことが更にその取柄である
Further, the safety of the method is another recommendation.
足を早めて進もう
Let us proceed at a brisk pace.
一直線に進む
to proceed in a straight line―go straight on―move straight on―hold on one's course―hold on one's way
困難を排して進む
to make one's way (through difficulties)
奮闘して進む
to fight one's way
一歩進むにも奮闘して進んだ
We fought every inch of the ground.
人込みの中を押し分けて進んだ
I pushed my way―elbowed my way―through the crowd.
無理に進む
to force one's way
艦隊は全速力で敵に向かって進んだ
The squadron bore down upon the enemy at full speed.
日本軍は破竹の勢で進んだ
The Japanese carried everything before them.
世と共に進む(時世に後れぬ)
to keep up with the times―keep pace with the times―keep breast of the times―move with the times
君は始めの調子で進めばきっと成功する
If you will keep on as you have begun, you will be sure to succeed.
日に十ページずつ進む
We read ten pages a day.
船は暴風に向かって進めなかった
The ship could not make head against the gale.
気は早れども足は進まず
“The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
進まざる者は退く
He who will not advance, will fall behind.
彼は進むことを知って退くことをしらぬ(猪武者)
He is foolhardy.
進むばかりが勇気じゃない
“Discretion is the better part of valour.”

content: 2. (=進歩する) to progress (in one's studies); to advance (in knowledge); to improve(in one's work); to get on; to get along (with one's work); to get ahead of (the others)

content.content: 君は学問が進んだ
You have progressed in your studies―advanced in knowledge.
彼は学問が進んでいる
He is advanced in his studies―forward in his studies―well up in his studies.
早く進む
He makes rapid progress.
着々進む
He makes steady progress.
著しく進む、めききめ進む
He makes remarkable progress.
めっきり進んだ
He has made remarkable progress.
彼は学問が進まぬ
He makes no progress in his studies.
君は英語が進んだ
You have improved in your English.
彼は英語が進んでいる
He is forward in English―well up in English.
この級は英語が進んでいる
This class is advanced in English.
彼は全級で一番に英語が進んでいる
He is ahead of his class―in advance of his class―in English.
どうだ英語が進むか
How are you getting along with your English?
人智が進む
Intellect progresses―Knowledge advances.
科学が進む
Science advances.
十九世紀は科学が進んだ
The Nineteenth Century advanced in science.
文明が進む
Civilization advances.
世は文明に進む
The world advances in civilization.
文明が進むに従って詩が衰える
As civilization advances, poetry declines―Poetry declines with the advance of civilization.
文明が進むに従って戦争が無くなる
With the advance of civilization, man will cease from strife.
世が進むに従って人は賢くなる
Man grows in wisdom with the progress of the ages.
日本は隣国より進んでいる
Japan is ahead of her neighbours―in advance of her neighbours.
進んだ国民
an advanced people
進んだ学生
advanced students
彼はこの問題について進んだ考えを持っている
He has advanced views―forward views―enlightened views―on the subject.
工事はだいぶ進んでいる
The works are well forward.
彼の思想は十年進んでいる
His ideas are ten years ahead of the age.
人は進まなくなると退き始める
If a man ceases to progress, he begins to retrograde.
彼は進みも退きもせぬ
He is stationary.
時計が進む
A clock or a watch gains―goes too fast.
お宅の時計は進みますか後れますか
Does your clock gain or lose?
一日に十分進みます
It gains ten minutes a day.
今進んでいますか後れていますか
Is it fast or slow?
五分進んでいます
It is five minutes too fast.
ドンより五分進んでいます
It is five minutes ahead of the gun.
食が進む
to have a good appetite
運動すると食が進む
Exercise will give you a good appetite.
僕は食が進まなくて困る
I have a poor appetite―I have no appetite at all.
病勢が進む
A disease advances―A disease progresses―A disease gains ground―One grows worse.
病勢が進む方だ
The disease is on the advancing hand.
病勢が進んでいる
The disease is in an advanced state―He is far gone.
彼の肺病はだいぶ進んでいる
His consumption is in an advanced stage―He is in an advanced stage of consumption―He is far gone in consumption.
彼の肺病は進まない
His consumption makes no progress.
病勢の進んだ患者
an advanced case
気は進む
to be willing―forward―eager
娘はたいそう進んでいる
The girl is quite willing.
気が進まぬ
to be unwilling―backward―reluctant―disinclined―indisposed
気が進まないなら止した方が好い
If you feel disinclined,―feel indisposed,―you had better desist.
今日は仕事をするに気が進まぬ
I am in no humour for working―in no mood for working―in no vein for working―today.
彼は気が進まないと黙っている
He keeps silent when he is in no humour―in no mood―in no vein―for talking.
買い手は進まぬ
The buyers hold back―hang back.
自ら進んで
of one's own accord―of one's own choice―of one's own free will―of one's own motion―on one's own initiative―voluntarily
彼に勧めはせぬ彼が自ら進んで金をだしたのだ
I did not try to persuade him; he gave the money of his own accord.
自ら進んで事をする
to act upon one's own initiative
彼はいつも自ら進んで新案を発議する
He always proposes new measures on his own initiative―of his own motion.
彼は自ら進んでその任に当たった
He volunteered to take the trust on himself.
彼は自ら進んであの主任に仕えている
He was a willing slave.

content:

content.content: 皆外へ出て涼んでいる

Let us cool ourselves a little before going to bed.
涼みに出る
to go out for the evening cool
涼みに行こうじゃないか
Let us go out and cool ourselves!
涼みがてら公園へ行って来た
I have been to the park by way of airing.

すずむし〔鈴虫〕
〈名〉A kind of cricket (highly prized for its song)

content:
すすめ〔勧め〕
〈名〉
1. (=説き勧め)persuasion; exhortation; advice:(=る) to try to persuade (one to do something); to try to prevail upon (one to do something); to advise (one to do something); to exhort (one to industry); to urge (one to work hard, etc.)

content.content: 勧めて承知させる
to persuade one―prevail upon one―(to do something)［注意］「勧めて承知さした」には“persuade”に用い、「勧めても承知せぬ」には “prevail upon” を用いる。
彼に結婚を勧めてやっと承知さした
I have at last persuaded him to marry.
彼にいくら結婚を勧めてもどうしても承知しない
I can not prevail upon him to marry.
彼には勧めても駄目だ
It is no use trying to persuade him―He is not to be prevailed upon.
彼に勧めはしない彼が自ら進んで金を出したのだ
I did not try to persuade him. He gave the money of his own accord.
彼はようやく僕の勧めに従った
He has yielded to my persuasion at last.
(医者が患者に向かって)旅行をお勧め申す
I would advise you to travel―I recommend you travelling.
医者の勧めによって旅行に行くことにしました
On my doctor's advice, I have decided to go on a journey.
先生がしきりに勉強を勧める
Our teacher urges us to work hard―exhorts us to industry.
善を勧める
to exhort one to virtue
善を勧め悪を懲らしめる
to reward virtue and punish vice
雌鶏勧めて雄鶏時をつくる
The hen sets the cock crowing.

content: 2. (=推薦) recommendation:(=る) to recommend (one something)

content.content: 医者が患者に向かって海水浴をお勧め申します
I would advise you to go to the seaside―I recommend you sea-bathing.
一人君に勧めたい先生がある
I wish to recommend you a teacher.
お勧めに従ってその人を使ってみよう
I will employ him on your recommendation.
せっかくのお勧めだからその人を使うことにしよう
Since you are so carnest in recommending him, I will employ him.
友人がせっかく勧めるからその人を使うことにした
I have decided to employ the man at the instance of―at the pressing instance of―a friend.
この本なら君にお勧め申す
I can recommend the book to you.

content: 3. (=奨励) encouragement:(=る) to encourage (one to do something)

content.content: 彼に勧めてやらしてみよう
I will encourage him to try.
知事が農家に養鶏を勧める
The governor encourages the farmers to keep poultry.

content: 4. (=る)(=献ずる) to offer (one something)

content.content: 酒を勧める
to offer one a glass of wine
茶を勧める
to offer one a cup of tea

content: 5. (=る)(=強いる) to press (anything on one)

content.content: 女は僕にしきりに酒を勧めた
She pressed the wine upon me―plied me with wine.

content:
すずめ〔雀〕
〈名〉The sparrow

A sparrow chirps.
あの子は雀のさえずるようにしゃべる
She chatters like a sparrow
雀海に入って蛤と成る
Sparrows (were said to) enter the sea and become clams.
鷹につかまれた雀のようだ
He is a chicken in a hawk's talons.
雀の涙ほど
a thimbleful (of brandy)―a toothful (of whiskey, etc.)

content:
すすめる〔進める〕
〈他動〉
1. (=前へ進める)to advance; to put forward

content.content: 軍を進める
to advance an army(against the enemy)
時計を進める
to put forward a watch―put on a clock
時計が後れているから五分進めて下さい
The clock is too slow. Put it forward five minutes.
歩を進める
to progress
工事は着々歩を進めている
The works make steady progress.
地歩を進める
to gain ground―gather ground
新説が地歩を進めた
The new theory has gained ground.
皆膝を進めて聴いた
Everybody drew closer to listen.
話を進めてよろしいか
May I go on with the negotiations?
調査を進めて下さい
Please proceed with the investigation―go on with the investigation―go ahead with the investigation.
研究を進めています
I am proceeding with the study.
これは植物であるという説に基づいて研究を進めて来ました
I have proceeded on the theory that it is a plant.
位を進める
to raise one in rank―promote one in rank
特旨をもって位一級進めらる
He is raised one grade in court rank as a special act of grace.

content: 4. (=渉らせる) to hasten; to speed

content.content: 工事を進める
to hasten the works―speed up the works
事務を進める
to speed business―accelerate business

content: 5. (=献ずる) to present (one something); to offer (one something)

content.content: 酒を進める
to offer one a glass of wine
少女が彼に茶を進めた
The girl offered him a cup of tea.

すずらん〔鈴蘭〕
〈名〉The lily of the valley

すずりばこ〔硯箱〕
〈名〉An ink-stone box

to sip tea―sup tea
茶をすすりながら話した

粥をすする

粥をすすって露命をつなぐ
to keep body and soul together on gruel
洟{はな}をすする
to sniff―snuff
二人は血をすすって兄弟の誓いを立てた
They drank each other's blood, and became sworn brothers.
肉を食い血をすすってなお飽き足らぬ奴だ

content:

〈名〉→『

content.content: ずかい〔図解〕

〈名〉The skirt (of a gown); the train (of a woman's skirt); the bottom (of trousers); the skirts (of a mountain)

content.content: 裾を引く
to trail the skirt
芸者が裾を引く
A geisha trails her skirt.
山が裾を引く
A mountain sweeps.
山の裾
the skirts of a mountain
裾を端折る
to tuck up the skirt
裾をまくる
to roll up the skirt
裾模様
design on the skirt (of a lady's dress)
裾持ち
a train-bearer

content:
すその〔裾野〕
〈名〉The skirts (of a mountain)

content.content: 富士の裾野
the skirts of Mt. Fuji

すそまわし〔裾回し〕
〈名〉The edge of the skirt

すそもよう〔裾模様〕
〈名〉Design on the skirt (of a lady's dress)

content:
すそわけ〔裾分け〕
〈名〉Sharing a gift with another:(=する) to share (a gift with another)

content.content: 到来物が有るから君と裾分けしよう
I will share with you a present which I have received.

content:
すだく
〈自動〉
1. (=集る、群る)to gather; to swarm; to crowd
2. (=虫が集り鳴く)to chirp together; to chirp in chorus

content.content: 草叢にすだく虫の音いと哀れなり

content:
スタコラ
〈副〉In a hurry; hurry-scurry; helter-skelter

content.content: と聞いて彼はスタコラ出て行った
On hearing the news, he went out in a hurry.
雨が降ってきたので皆スタコラ駆け出した
It began to rain, and everybody broke into a run.
巡査を見て皆スタコラ逃げ出した
Seeing the officer, they scampered away―scuttled away―scurried away.
スタコラ歩く
to hurry about―bustle about

content:
スタスタ
〈副〉Briskly; at a brisk pace

content.content: スタスタ歩く
to walk briskly
スタスタ通る
to pass at a brisk pace

ずだずだ〔寸断寸断〕
〈副〉→『

content.content: ずたずたに〔寸断寸断に〕

content:
ずたずたに〔寸断寸断に〕
〈副〉To pieces

content.content: ズタズタに斬る
to hack a body to pieces―hew and hack a body to pieces―hackle a body to pieces
手紙をふんだくってズタズタに裂いてしまった
I snatched the letter and tore it to pieces.

content:
すだちする〔巣立ちする〕
〈自動〉
1. (=子鳥が巣を去る)to leave the nest

content.content: 巣立ちの鳥
a young bird fresh from the nest―a fledgling

content:
2. (=産褥を離れる)to leave one's bed after confinement
3. (=独立する)to become independent; to get on one's legs

すだて〔素建て〕
〈形〉New-built (house) without fittings

content.content: その家は素建てだ
The house is a new-built one without its fittings.

ずだぶくろ〔頭陀袋〕
〈名〉A scrip; a wallet

content:
すたり〔廃り〕
〈名〉(事)waste; wastage:(物)waster; wastrel

content.content: 材料の廃りが出る
Materials go to waste.
人に廃りは無い
Every man is useful in his way.
物に廃りは無い
Everything is useful in its place.

すたりもの〔廃り物〕
〈名〉A useless thing; an obsolete thing; an antiquated thing:(製造の材料のは) waster; wastrel:(人なら) a good-for-nothing

content:
すだれ〔簾〕
〈名〉A bamboo-blind

content.content: 簾を下ろす
to let down a blind
簾を捲く
to roll up a blind
風が悋気で簾捲く
The jealous wind raises the blind.
吹けよ川風
Blow, river-zephyr, blow,
簾を捲けよ
And raise the jealous blind!
今の小唄の
For I would have thee show
主見たや
Who kills me from behind.
簾越しに見る
to see through a blind

content:
すたれる〔廃れる〕
〈自動〉
1. To go out of use; to fall into disuse:(流行なら) to go out of fashion:(習慣なら) to go out of vogue; to fall into desuetude:(遊戯なら) to go out of favour:(言葉なら) to become obsolete; to die out:(建物なら) to become dilapidated; to fall into ruins:(材料なら) to go to waste:(旧式になるの意味なら) to go out of date:(古臭くなるの意味なら) to become antiquated:(廃されるの意味なら) to be abolished; to be done away with:(棄てられるの意味なら) to be discarded:(新しいものができて古いものが廃れる) to be superseded

content.content: この読本はもう廃れた
These readers have gone out of use―fallen into disuse―They are now out of use―in disuse.
廃れた教科書
a disused text-book
流行が廃れる
Fashions go out.
この柄はもう廃れた
These patterns have gone out of fashion―They are now out of fashion.
習慣が廃れる
Customs go out of vogue―fall into desuetude.
廃れた習慣
an antiquated custom
戦闘艦は十五年経つと廃れる
A battleship goes out of date―becomes obsolete―in 15 years.
廃れた戦闘艦
an obsolete battleship―an out-of-date battleship
日本刀は維新このかた廃れている
The Japanese sword has fallen into disuse―been discarded―since the Restoration.
言葉が廃れる
Words become obsolete―die out.
廃れた言葉
an obsolete word
武士道は廃れた
Bushido has become antiquated.
建物が廃れる
A building falls into ruins―becomes dilapidated.
廃れた寺
a ruined temple―a dilapidated temple
廃れた寺院を再興する
to restore a ruined temple
材料が廃れる
Materials go to waste.
古い機械は原料が廃れる
The old machinery wastes the raw material.
新しい機械は原料が廃れない
The new machinery prevents the raw material from going to waste.
電灯ができてランプが廃れた
The electric light has superseded the oil-lamp―The electric light has taken the place of the oil-lamp―The oil-lamp has given place to the electric light.
そんなことをすると男が廃れる
If I do such a thing, I shall dishonour myself―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Such conduct will dishonour me.

スチュー

content.content: 肉をスチューにする

How dare you, a mere pleb, say such a thing to a samurai?

content:
ずつ〔宛〕
〈副〉At a time; each; apiece:(前置詞に用いれば)by

content.content: 一つずつ、一人ずつ
one at a time―one by one
一文ずつ勘定する
to count piece by piece
少しずつ学ぶよりほかは無い
We must learn little by little―a little at a time.
三人ずつ呼べ
Call three at a time.
一人に五円ずつやれ
Give them five yen each―five yen apiece.
日本の人口は年に七十万ずつ増える

机を三人に一脚ずつ当てがう
Allow one table to every three persons.
各種を五個ずつ買おう
I will take five of each kind.
一軒ずつまわって遊説して歩いた
I went talking to the people, from door to door.

content:
ずつう〔頭痛〕
〈名〉Headache

content.content: 頭痛がする
I have a headache.
時々頭痛がする
I am troubled with frequent headaches―subject to frequent headaches.
彼は頭痛持ちだ
He is subject to headaches.
彼は頭痛がすると言う
He complains of a headache.
頭の割れるような頭痛がした
I had a splitting headache.
散歩すると頭痛が治る
I walk off my headache.
試験の答案が頭痛の種だ
The examination-papers I must look over give me the headache.
借金が頭痛の種だ
My debts cause me anxiety.
彼は人の疝気を頭痛に病む
He can not let others alone―can not let alone anything which he thinks going wrong.
人の疝気を頭痛に病むな
Let others alone!―Mind your own business!

content:
すっかり〔悉皆〕
〈副〉Quite; all; everything; clean; clear

content.content: すっかり忘れておった

すっかり君に任せる

もうすっかり大人になったね
You are quite grown up.
すっかり借金を返した
I have paid all my debts―cleared off my debts.
すっかり打明け給え

魚がすっかり水から出ている
The fishes are clean out of the water.
廊下がすっかり通っている
The corridor runs clear through the house.
様子がすっかり変わった
All is changed.
彼は台湾に一年居てすっかり身体をこわして来た
One year of Formosa has broken him all up.

content.content: すっくと立ち上がる
to assume an erect posture

content:

content:
ずっと〔ズッと〕
〈副〉
1. (=遙かに)far; away:(時なら)long

content.content: 松前のずっと向こうの夜国とやらに
in the Land of Night far beyond Matsumae
ずっと北の方に
away to the northward―way north
ずっと上に
way up―high up
ずっと下に
way down―low down
ずっと前のことだ
It happened long ago.
それよりずっと前に
long before that
ずっと昔のその昔
long, long ago
君達の生まれるずっと前のことだ
It happened long before you were born.
この方がずっと好い
This is far better than that―by far the better of the two.

content: 2. (=ブッ通し)through; throughout; all the time; ever

content.content: 休暇中ずっと箱根にいました
I stayed at Hakone through the holidays―throughout the holidays.
あれからずっとここに居ります
I have been here ever since.
ずっとお勉強かね
You have been hard at work all this while?
ここから海岸までずっと平地だ
A level country stretches from here to the coast.

content: 3. (=真直に)straight; right

content.content: ズっとお通りなさい
Walk straight in!―Walk right in!
ズっとお進みなさい
Draw close!
この通りをズッと真直においでなさい
Go straight on!―Keep straight on!

この方がずっと好い
This is far better than that―by far the better of the two.

content.content: 休暇中ずっと箱根にいました
I stayed at Hakone through the holidays―throughout the holidays.
あれからずっとここに居ります
I have been here ever since.
ずっとお勉強かね

content:

〈形〉Sour

content.content: 牛乳が酸っぱくなる

雷が鳴ると牛乳が酸っぱくなる

口が酸っぱくなるほどしゃべった

He is in a state of nature―There is not a shred of clothing on him―He has not a thing on.

content:

content.content: 新聞にその会社の内幕のすっぱ抜きが長々と出ている

すっぱぬく〔素破抜く〕
〈他動〉To expose (a villain or his villainy); to unmask (a villain); to show up (an impostor); to give away (a secret or one's pal); to lay bare (a secret); to let on; to peach; to tell

content.content: すっぱ抜くぞ
I will expose you―I will peach―I will tell.
あのことをすっぱ抜いちゃいやよ

彼は仲間をすっぱ抜くようなことはせぬ

content:

content.content: さあこの首をスッパリと切って貰いましょう

content.content: 月とスッポンだ

content:

content:
すてうり〔捨売り〕

to sell anything at a sacrifice―sell anything for a song―sell anything dirt-cheap
家族が東京を去る時家を捨て売りにして行った

content:
すておく〔捨置く〕
〈他動〉To let (one) alone; to leave (one) alone; to let (anything) be; to let (anything) go; to let (anything) pass; to pass over (a matter); to overlook (a matter)

content.content: 彼にかまうな捨て置け
Let him alone!―Leave him alone―Let him be!
親子の情として捨て置くことはできね
My parental affection forbids my leaving him alone.
このことはこのままに捨て置かれぬ
I can not leave the matter as it is―pass over the matter in silence―let the matter drop.
君の一身上に関する事件だから捨て置かれぬ
You must look to the matter,―The matter must be looked to,―for it concerns your welfare.
間違いは間違いだが捨て置け
It is a mistake, to be sure, but let it go―let it pass.
捨て置かれぬ弊害だ
It is a crying evil.

content:
すておぶね〔捨小舟〕
〈名〉A drifting boat

content.content: 身は捨小舟、寄辺渚の捨小舟
(取りつく島も無いの意味なら)I am thrown upon my own resources―(頼る人が無いの意味なら)―I am thrown upon the world―(路頭に迷うの意味なら)―I am turned adrift.

content:
すてがたい〔捨て難い〕
〈形〉Of some good; of some use

content.content: 捨て難い人だ
There is some good in him―There is something in him.
捨て難い風情の有る女だ
There is still a certain charm about her.

content:
すてがね〔捨鐘〕
〈名〉The first three bells which do not count

content.content: 三つは捨て鐘
The first three do not count.

content:
すてき〔素敵〕
〈形〉Capital; glorious; stunning; spanking; rattling; ripping; thundering

content.content: こりゃすてきだ
Capital!
すてきに好い天気だ
It is glorious weather.
世間はすてきな景気だ
The times are glorious.
すてきな美人だ
She is a stunning beauty―a spanking fine woman.
こりゃすてきに好い酒だ
This is spanking good wine.
すてきなご馳走だった
It was a capital dinner―a rattling dinner―a stunning spread―a spanking spread―a ripping spread―a thundering spread.
こりゃすてきな代物だ、すてきめっぽう珍無類だ、とてもすてきね
It is a stunner―a spanker―a rattler―a ripper―a scorcher―a screamer―a smasher―a whopper.

content:
すてご〔捨子〕
〈名〉A deserted child; an exposed child; an abandoned child; a foundling; a waif

content.content: 捨て子をする
to desert a child―expose a child―abandon a child
あの子は捨て子を拾い上げて育てたのだ
The child is a foundling.

content:
すてことば〔捨言葉〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: すてぜりふ〔捨台詞〕

content:
すてーしょん〔停車場<ステーション>〕
〈名〉A (railway) station

content.content: 汽車がステーションを離れる
A train leaves the station―clears the station―gets clear of the station.
我が汽車は早やステーションを離れたり
We are clear of the station.
汽車がステーションに着く
A train arrives at a station.
汽車がステーションに停車する
A train stops at a station.
ステーションへ人を見送りに行った
I went to the station to see a friend off.
ステーションへ人を迎えに行った
I went to the station to meet a friend.
ステーションで逢おう
We shall meet at the station.

content:
すてーしょん〔停車場<ステーション>〕
〈名〉A (railway) station

content.content: 汽車がステーションを離れる
A train leaves the station―clears the station―gets clear of the station.
我が汽車は早やステーションを離れたり
We are clear of the station.
汽車がステーションに着く
A train arrives at a station.
汽車がステーションに停車する
A train stops at a station.
ステーションへ人を見送りに行った
I went to the station to see a friend off.
ステーションへ人を迎えに行った
I went to the station to meet a friend.
ステーションで逢おう
We shall meet at the station.

content:
すてぜりふ〔捨台詞〕
〈名〉A parting shot; a Parthian shaft

content.content: 捨てぜりふを言う
to say something over one's shoulder
「じゃ勝手にしろ」と捨てぜりふを残して行った
“Much good may it do you!” said he over his shoulder.

content:
ステッキ
〈名〉A stick; a walking-stick

content.content: ステッキをついて歩く
He leans on a stick―walks with a stick.
ステッキを振りまわして歩く
He flourishes his stick as he goes.

content:
すてどころ〔捨所〕
〈名〉A dumping ground

content.content: 元老院古い老爺の捨て所
Superannuated men are relegated to the Senate.
ここは命の捨て所
Now is the time to lay down your life.

content:
すでに〔既に〕
〈副〉
1. (=もはや)already:(前置詞に用いれば)by (this or that time)

content.content: 彼は既に去りぬ
He is gone already.
既に報に接せり
I have already heard the news.
そう言うのが既に間違っている
To say so is already a mistake.
今頃は既に、あの時は既に
by this (time)―by that time
彼は今頃は既に目的地に達しているだろう
He must have got to his journey's end by this.
その頃は既に彼は隠退の身であった
By that time, he had retired from active life.
正午には万事既に済む
By noon, all is over.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 行ってみればその人は既に亡し
I found him dead and gone.
既に晩し{おそし}
It is too late.
病既に膏肓{こうこう}に入っている
It is all over with the invalid.
学者の生活が既に衛生に害が有る
The very life of a scholar is unsanitary.

content: 2. (=まさに)(to be) about (to do something); (to be) on the point of (doing something); to come near (doing something)

content.content: 既に溺れんとした
I was on the point of being drowned―I came near being drowned.
既に危かった、既にこうよと見えた
He was in imminent danger.
既に危かりし時(既にこうよと見えた時)救われた
He was delivered from imminent danger―He was snatched from the jaws of death―He was saved at the critical moment.

content:
すでにして〔既にして〕
〈副〉Already; now

content.content: 既にして日は西山に入りぬ
The sun is now down.

content:
すでにすでに〔已に業に〕
〈副〉Long ago

content.content: その人は已にすでに亡し
He died long ago―He has long been dead―He is no more.
已にすでに晩し
It is too late.

content:
すてね〔捨値〕
〈名〉A slaughter price; a sacrifice:(=に) at a slaughter price; at a sacrifice; for a song; for a mere song; for an old song; dirt-cheap; dog-cheap

content.content: この家を捨て値に買った
I bought the house for a song―I had the house (at) a dead bargain.
家族が東京を去る時に家を捨て値に売って行った
When the family left Tokyo, the house was sold at a sacrifice―sold for a mere song.

content:
すてば〔捨場〕
〈名〉A dumping ground

content.content: 芥捨て場
a refuse-heap―(米国にては)―a dump―a dumping ground
この物品の捨て場が無い
We do not know where to dump these goods.
古い老爺の捨て場は元老院
Superannuated men are relegated to the Senate.

content:
すてばち〔捨鉢〕
〈名〉Despair; desperation; self-abandonment:(=の) desperate

content.content: 捨て鉢になる
to abandon oneself to despair―become desperate
彼は捨て鉢になっている
He is desperate.
彼は失敗して捨て鉢になっている
Failure has made him desperate.
捨て鉢を言う
to talk in desperation
そんな捨て鉢を言うものでない
You should refrain from such words of desperation.

すてぶち〔捨扶持〕
〈名〉A pension

content:
すてみ〔捨身〕
〈名〉Self-abandonment; desperation

content.content: 捨て身になる
to abandon oneself to despair―become desperate―risk one's life
捨て身になってかかった
I went at it with the courage of despair―at the risk of my life.

content:
すてる〔捨てる、棄てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=投げ捨てる)to throw away; to cast away; to fling away

content.content: 芥を捨てる
to dump refuse
塵芥を捨てるべからず
No refuse here.
そんな金は溝(とぶ)へ捨てたも同然だ
The money is as good as thrown away―It is a sheer waste of money.
秋の扇と捨てられる
to be thrown away like an old hat
着物を捨てる(かなぐり捨てる)
to cast off a coat―lay aside a coat

content: 2. (=見捨てる) to abandon (a girl); to desert (one's wife); to forsake (a friend); to discard (a mistress); to give up (an ally); to give over, throw over (a lover); to turn one's back upon (an unfortunate person, etc.)

content.content: 女を捨てる
to abandon a girl―give over a sweetheart―discard a mistress
女が男に捨てられた
She was given over―thrown over―by her lover.
(女が)男を捨てる
to throw over a lover―jilt a lover (for another)
妻が夫に捨てられた
She was deserted by her husband.
子を捨てる
to desert a child―expose a child―abandon a child
彼は世に捨てられた
He was cast out of society―Society east him forth.
彼は困っている友人を捨てるような人じゃない
He is not the man to desert―forsake―turn his back upon―a friend in need.
窮境に在る友を捨てる
to leave a man in the lurch
船を捨てる(乗り捨てる)
to abandon a ship to her fate―leave a ship to her fate
(航海中)人を孤島に捨てる
to maroon a man on a desert island
持ち場を捨てる、職を捨てる(卑怯を働く)
to desert one's post―desert one's trust―give up one's ship
職を捨てるな
Do not give up your ship!
神に捨てられる
to be reprobated (by God)
あれは神に捨てられた人だ
He is a reprobate.
捨てる神は有れば助ける神が有る
“The angel goes out that the archangel may come in.”
彼だってそう捨てたものでない
He is not so hopeless as you think―He may prove of some service―He must be good for something.
僕だってそう捨てたものじゃありませんよ
I am good for something.
捨て難い男だ
There is some good in him―There is something in him.
捨て難い風情の有る女だ
There is a certain charm about her.
まんざら捨てたものでもない
He is not without his good point―It is not without its good point.

content: 3. (=放棄する) to abandon, give up (an attempt); to renounce, abjure (one's faith); to renounce, relinquish, disclaim, waive (a right); to relinquish, resign, forego (a claim); to resign, deliver up (one's possessions); to throw up, fling up (one's office); to sacrifice, lay down (one's life); to lay aside (some work); to part with (conceit, etc.)

content.content: 世を棄てる
to renounce the world―die to the world
僕は世を棄てている
I am dead to the world.
彼は世を棄てて一生を慈善事業に委ねた
He renounced the world, and devoted his life to works of charity.
身を棄てる
to sacrifice one's life―risk one's life
身を棄ててこそ浮かぶ瀬もあれ
“Risk all, and gain all.”
命を棄てる
to sacrifice one's life―lay down one's life
国家の為ならいつでも命を棄てる
I am ready to lay down my life for my country―give my life for my country.
あたら命をただ棄てた
He threw away his precious life in vain.
彼女は自分の命を棄てて子どもを助けた
She saved the child at the price of her our life.
良心を棄てて富貴になった
He grew rich at the cost of a clear conscience.
健康を棄てて成功した
He succeeded at the sacrifice of his health.
日本語を棄てて英語を学んだ
He learned English at the expense of his Japanese.
己を棄てる
to sacrifice oneself―sink oneself―rise above self―die to self
己を棄て人の為に尽くす
to die to oneself and live for others
利益を棄てる
to sacrifice one's interests―sink one's own interests
主義の為に利益を棄てる
to sacrifice one's interests to one's principles
主義を棄てる
to abandon one's principles―desert one's colours
僕は主義を棄てぬ
I will adhere to my principles―stick to my colours.
権利を棄てる
to renounce a right―disclaim a right―waive a right―relinquish a right―(権利の主張なら)―relinquish a claim―resign a claim―forego a claim
地位を棄てる
to throw up one's office―fling up one's situation
宗教を棄てる
to renounce one's faith―abjure one's faith
事を棄てる(断念する)
to abandon the attempt―give up the attempt―(in despair)
剣を棄てて筆を取る(兵家の事を棄てて筆取る身となる)
to give up the sword for the pen
本を棄てて銃を取る
The book is laid aside for the gun.
日本は在来の文明を棄てて泰西の文物制度を取った
Japan laid aside her old civilization for Western culture and institutions.
事業は一年間も棄ててある
The work has been laid aside for a year.
王位を棄てる
to abdicate the throne
棄てるべきものは弓矢なりけり
I would fain give up the sword.
学者のまず第一に為すべきことは慢心を棄てることである
The first business of the philosopher is to part with conceit.

content: 4. (=棄却する) to leave (anything); to reject (an article); to condemn (an article); to discard (a habit, etc.)

content.content: 取るか捨てるか
to take or leave anything
長を取り短を捨てる
to take what is good and leave what is bad
身の習慣を棄てる
to discard a habit―give up a habit
人情を棄てる(心を鬼にする)
to divest oneself of humanity
捨てられた品
rejected articles―condemned goods

すてる〔捨てる、棄てる〕
〈他動〉
1. (=投げ捨てる)to throw away; to cast away; to fling away

事を棄てる(断念する)

to abdicate the throne
