content: 4. (=棄却する) to leave (anything); to reject (an article); to condemn (an article); to discard (a habit, etc.)

content.content: 取るか捨てるか
to take or leave anything
長を取り短を捨てる
to take what is good and leave what is bad
身の習慣を棄てる
to discard a habit―give up a habit
人情を棄てる(心を鬼にする)
to divest oneself of humanity
捨てられた品
rejected articles―condemned goods

content:
ステロ
〈名〉Stereo; stereotype

content.content: 本をステロに取る
to stereotype a book
これはステロにとったようなきまり文句だ
This is a stereotyped expression.

content:
すどおり〔素通り〕
〈名〉Passing through (a place) without stopping; passing (a house) without calling:(=する) to pass through (a place) without stopping; to pass (a house) without calling

content.content: ヨーロッパへ行った時米国を素通りに通った
On my way to Europe, I passed through America (without stopping there).
素通りはひどいじゃないか
Isn't it too bad of you to pass my door without looking in?
あの人は酒屋の前を素通りすることができない
He has an unconquerable love for liquor.

content:
ストーブ
〈名〉A stove

content.content: ストーブを焚く
to make a fire in the stove―light the stove
ストーブを焚いている
There is a fire in the stove―They have a fire up.

content:
ストライキ
〈名〉A strike; a walk-out

content.content: ストライキをやる
to go on strike―strike (work)―walk out
職工は増給問題でストライキをやっている
The men have struck for higher wages.
近頃はあっちでもこっちでもストライキが大流行だ
Strikes are in the air.
あの先生は時々ストライキをやられる
He often has his students strike.

すどり〔巣鶏〕
〈名〉A brooding hen

ずどり〔図取り〕
〈名〉Sketching:(=する) to sketch (a scene, etc.)

content:
ズドン
〈擬音詞〉(爆声なら)bang:(落ちる音なら)thud

content.content: ズドンと一声
Bang! went the gun.
ズドンと落ちる
to fall with a thud

content:
すとんと〔ストンと〕
〈副〉With a thump

content.content: ストンと転んだ
Over he went.

content:
すとんと〔ストンと〕
〈副〉With a thump

content.content: ストンと転んだ
Over he went.

content:
すな〔砂〕
〈名〉Sand:(海岸などの砂原の意味なら) the sands

content.content: 子どもらは砂の上に遊んでいる
The children are playing on the sands.
この土地は砂が多い
The soil is sandy.
床に砂を振り撒く
to sprinkle sand on the floor―sprinkle the floor with sand―sand the floor
砂を振り撒いた床
a sanded floor
金属を砂で磨く
to sand metal
うまい物に砂の入ったよう(に相当するは)
It is a hair in the soup.
後足で砂をかける
to leave a place with imprecations upon it―turn one's back upon one
あれは好い口があると後足で砂をかけて行く奴だ
He will turn his back upon you as soon as he finds a good opening.

content:
すなお〔素直〕
〈形〉Pliant (branch); pliable (disposition); compliant (friend); docile (pupil); obedient (child); submissive (behaviour); tractable (horse); manageable (husband); meek (wife); gentle (disposition); mild (temper); frank (avowal); yielding (nature, etc.)

content.content: あの男は素直な質だ
He is of a pliable disposition.
赤松は枝が素直だ
The red pine has plaint branches.
子どもは素直にするものだ
A child should be obedient.
素直に人の言うことをお聞きなさい
You must obey me.
素直に白状すれば赦してやる
If you will confess frankly, I will pardon you.
素直に渡す
to yield anything
素直に承知する
to yield consent
彼が素直にその品を出すかどうか疑問だ
It is a question whether he will yield up the article or not.
素直に縛に就く
to suffer oneself to be bound
素直に教えを貰え
Suffer yourself to be taught!

content:
すなごし〔砂漉し〕
〈名〉Filtration through sand

content.content: 水を砂漉しにする
to filter water through sand

ずなし〔図無し〕
〈名〉An extra size; an out size

content:
すなち〔砂地〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: すなじ〔砂地〕

すなどけい〔砂時計〕
〈名〉A sand-glass; an hour-glass

すなどる〔漁る〕
〈名〉To fish (for something)

content:
すなば〔砂場〕
〈名〉The sands

content.content: 子どもらが砂場に遊んでいる
The children are playing on the sands.

content:
すなはま〔砂浜〕
〈名〉A sandy beach; the sands

content.content: 子どもらが砂浜に遊んでいる
The children are playing on the sands.

すなはら〔砂原〕
〈名〉A sandy plain

すなぶくろ〔砂嚢〕
〈名〉A sand-bag:(鳥のは) the gizzard

すなぶろ〔砂風呂〕
〈名〉A sand-bath

content:
すなぼこり〔砂埃〕
〈名〉Dust

content.content: 風が吹くと砂埃が立つ
The wind raises a dust.
雨が降ると砂埃が立たぬ
The rain lays the dust.
自動車が砂埃を立てて通り過ぎた
A motor-car flashed past, raising a cloud of dust.
外はひどい砂埃だ
The roads are very dusty.

すなめり〔砂滑〕
〈名〉A kind of dolphin

すなやま〔砂山〕
〈名〉A sand-hill; a dune

content:
すなわち〔即ち、則ち、乃ち〕
〈副詞、接続詞〉
1. (=詳しく言えば) namely; that is to say; that is; to wit; viz.; or

content.content: 日本は四大島、即ち本州、九州、四国、北海道よりなる
Japan consists of four large islands, namely―the Main Island, Kyusyu, Shikoku, and Hokkaido.
これが明治神宮、即ち明治天皇を祀った宮である
This is the Meiji-Jingu, or the shrine sacred to the memory of the Emperor Meiji.

content: 2. (=こそ) exactly; precisely:(形容詞に訳せば) the very; the same

content.content: それが即ち僕の欲するところだ
That is exactly what I want―That is the very thing I want―That is what I want.
それが即ち僕のいつも言うことだ
That is precisely what I always say.
それが即ち僕の同意できないわけさ
That is precisely why I can not agree―That is the very reason why I can not agree―That is why I can not agree.
ここが即ち事の起こったところである
That is exactly where the event happened―This is the place where the event happened―This is where the event happened.
あれが即ち僕の見初めた婦人さ
That is the same lady I fell in love with at first sight.

content: 3. (=取りも直さず) nothing but; no other than; neither more nor less than:(動詞に訳せば)to mean; to spell

content.content: 「賢きに過ぐるなかれ」と言ったのは即ち Solomon である
The man who said “Be not wise overmuch.” is no other than Solomon―neither more nor less than Solomon―no less a personage than Solomon―Solomon himself.
これは即ち詐欺だ
This is nothing but a fraud―neither more nor less than a fraud.
彼を怒らせれば即ち僕の身の破滅だ
His displeasure means my ruin.
今度成功すれば即ち出世だ
Success spells advancement in life.

content: 4. (=その時には) then; when

content.content: 飢えれば則ち食し渇すれば則ち飲む
I eat when I am hungry, and drink when I am thirsty.

content: 5. (=そこで) and then; thereupon; whereupon

content.content: 敗軍の報到る、乃ち身を隠して再挙を図る
The news of defeat arrived, whereupon he concealed himself and prepared himself for another effort.

content:
すなわら〔砂原〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: すなはら〔砂原〕

content:
ずぬけて〔図抜けて〕
〈副〉Extraordinarily; exceptionally; out of the common:(最上級に伴えば)by far, out of sight, out and away (the best, etc.)

content.content: 彼は図抜けて学問ができる
He is an extraordinary scholar.
図抜けて背が高い
He is exceptionally tall.
あの人はどこか図抜けて偉いところが有る
There is something out of the common about him.
あの生徒は図抜けて英語ができる
He is by far the best English scholar in his class.

content:
すね〔脛〕
〈名〉The leg; the shank:(向こう脛) the shin

content.content: 脛を払う
to sweep one's legs from under one
親の脛をかじる
to depend on one's father―sponge on one's father
貴様はまだ親の脛をかじっているのか
Are you still dependent on your father?
もう親の脛をかじる年じゃない
You are too old to be dependent on your father―old enough to be independent of your father.
脛かじり
a sponge―a hanger-on
脛に傷持つ身は薄の穂にも恐れる
“A guilty conscience needs no accuser.”
彼は脛に傷持つ身だから始終びくびくものだ
He is in constant fear because of his guilty conscience.

すねあて〔脛当て〕
〈名〉Leggings:(蹴球用のは) leg-guards; shin-guards

すねかじり〔脛噛り〕
〈名〉A sponge; a hanger-on

content:
すねもの〔拗者〕
〈名〉A crabbed fellow; a perverse character

content.content: 天下の拗者
a cynic

content:
すねる〔拗る〕
〈自動〉To pout; to sulk; to turn sulky

content.content: 美人がすねている
She is in the sulks―in the pouts.

content:
ずのう〔頭脳〕
〈名〉A head; an intellect; brains

content.content: 好い頭脳だ
He has a good head.
明晰な頭脳を持っている
He has a clear head―He is clear-headed.
鋭敏な頭脳だ
He has an acute intellect.
数学の頭脳が有る
He has a head for mathematics.
僕は投機の頭脳が無い
I have no head for speculation.
あの男は頭脳が無い
He has no brains.
頭脳を要する仕事だ
It is head-work―brain-work―intellectual work.

すのこ〔簀の子〕
〈名〉A kind of hurdle

content:
すのもの〔酢の物〕
〈名〉A vinegared dish; a fish salad

content.content: 牡蠣{かき}の酢の物
oysters in vinegar

content:
すばしこい
〈形〉Quick; smart; shrewd; sharp

content.content: あれはすばしこい男だ
He is a sharp fellow―a shrewd fellow―a smart fellow.
すばしこく立ちまわる
to be quick―look sharp
彼はすばしこく立ちまわって利益を逃がさない
He looks sharp after his interests.

content:
スパスパ
〈副〉With puffs

content.content: スパスパタバコを吸っている
He is puffing away―puffing vehemently at his pipe.

content:
すはだ〔素肌〕
〈名〉Bare skin

content.content: 素肌に上衣を引掛けた
I threw on my coat without any underwear.

content:
ずばぬける〔ズバ抜ける〕
〈自動〉To tower above the rest; to be by far the best; to be out of sight the best; to be out and away the best

content.content: 彼は学問がズバ抜けている
He is by far the greatest of all scholars.
あの相撲はズバ抜けて強い
He is out of sight the strongest of all wrestlers.

content:
すばやい〔素早い〕
〈形〉Quick; swift; nimble; alert; sharp; slick; deft

content.content: 挙動が素早い
He is quick in his movements―swift in his movements―nimble in his movements.
日本人は素早い
The Japanese are alert.
(人の働きぶりを評して)実に素早い
Sharp work!
素早い芸当
a deft performance―a slick feat

content:
すばらしい〔素晴しい〕
〈形〉Magnificent; splendid; superb; grand; glorious; immense; enormous; tremendous; stupendous; awful; amazing; astounding; prodigious; phenomenal; stunning; spanking; ripping rattling; thundering

content.content: 彼はすばらしい家に住んでいる
He lives in a splendid house―a magnificent house―a palace of a house.
すばらしい身形{みなり}をしている
He is superbly dressed―He looks very swell.
すばらしい身代だ
He has an immense fortune―an enormous fortune.
すばらしい美人だ
She is a stunning beauty.
すばらしい学者だ
He is a prodigious scholar.
世間はすばらしい景気だ
The times are glorious―There is a boom.
米国の財源はすばらしいものだ
America has immense resources―enormous resources―tremendous resources―stupendous resources.
今度の芝居はすばらしい当りだ
The new play is an amazing success―an astounding success―a phenomenal success.
すばらしいご馳走だった
It was a splendid dinner―a stunning dinner―a rattling dinner―a spanking spread―a ripping spread―a thundering spread.
こりゃすばらしい代物だ
It is a stunner―a spanker―a rattler―a ripper―a scorcher―a screamer―a smasher.

content:
ずびき〔図引き〕
〈名〉Drawing

content.content: 図引き機械
drawing instruments

content:
スープ
〈名〉Soup; broth

content.content: スープを吸う
eat soup―take broth
澄ましスープ
clean soup―consomm?
野菜スープ
vegetable soup
鳥肉スープ
chicken broth
スープ一皿
a dish of soup
スープ皿
a soup-plate
スープ匙
a table-spoon
スープ入れ
a tureen
スープ肉
soup-meat

content:
ずぶとい〔図太い〕
〈形〉Bold; daring; audacious; impudent

content.content: 昼中泥棒に入るとは図太い奴だ
What an audacious fellow to break into a house in broad daylight!

content:
ずぶぬれ〔ズブ濡れ〕
〈形〉(To be) drenched with rain, soaked with rain, wet to the skin, wet through and though, dripping wet

content.content: 雨降りに歩いてズブ濡れになった
I have been out walking in the rain, and got wet to the skin.

content:
ズブリ
〈副〉With a plunge

content.content: ズブリ刺す
to plunge a dagger into one's breast

content:
ずぶろく〔ズブ六〕
〈名〉Dead drunkenness

content.content: 彼はズブ六に酔っている
He is dead drunk.
ズブ六になるまで飲む
He drunks himself dead drunk.

content:
すべ〔術〕
〈名〉Means; resources

content.content: もはや術なし
I am at the end of my resources―I am at my wits' end.

content:
すべからく〔須く〕
〈副〉By all means:(助動詞に訳せば) should

content.content: すべからく何々すべし
One should do something―Let one do something.
男子すべからく英語を学ぶべし
A man should learn English.
語学を学ばばすべからく一カ国の語に止むべし
One who would learn languages, should confine himself to one.
英語を学ばんと欲せばすべからく助動詞の用法を極むべし
If you wish to learn English, you should master the auxiliary verbs.

すべくくる〔総べ括る〕
〈他動〉To control (the affairs of an office); to have general control over (a department, etc.)

content:
すべすべ〔滑々〕
〈形〉Smooth:(=した)smooth:(=する)to be smooth; to feel smooth

content.content: ビロードはすべすべする
Velvet feels smooth―Velvet is smooth to the feel.
頭が禿げてすべすべだ
His head is bald and smooth.

content:
すべた
〈名〉
1. (=醜婦)a plain woman; a homely woman; a fright
2. (=女の卑称)a hussy; a jade; a baggage

content.content: このすべため
You baggage!

content:
すべっこい〔滑っこい〕
〈形〉Slippery; smooth

content.content: 道は凍って滑っこい
The roads are slippery with ice.
石に青苔が生えていて滑っこい
The stones are slippery with slime.
西洋紙は滑っこい
Foreign paper is smooth.

content:
すべて〔凡て〕
〈名〉(=皆)all; everything; the whole:(副詞に用いれば)all; wholly; always:(=の)all; every; the whole

content.content: すべてを君に献ずる
I lay my all at your feet.
すべての点においてこちらが勝っている
This is superior to the other in all respects―in every respect.
色の黒い者はすべて丈夫だ
All dark men are strong―Dark men are all strong―Dark men are always strong.
彼はすべてに行き届いている
He is attentive to everything.
すべてこの調子だ
Do it always this way!
これがすべてでない
This is not all―This is not the whole of it.

content: 〈副〉(=概して)generally; generally speaking; as a general thing; as a rule

content.content: 女はすべて男よりも語学が好い
Generally speaking, a girl will make a better linguist than a boy―Girls, as a rule, make better linguists than boys.

content:
すべらす〔滑らす〕
〈他動〉To let slip

content.content: 口を滑らす
to make a slip of the tongue
筆を滑らす
to make a slip of the pen
足を滑らす
to slip
足を滑らして転んだ
I slipped and fell.

content:
すべり〔滑り〕
〈名〉Slipping; sliding:(一滑り)a slip; a slide:(氷滑り)skating

content.content: 絹裏は滑りが好い
Silk lining slips well.
滑り路
a slide
滑り靴
skates
(馬蹄の)滑り止め
a rough
(橇の)滑り坂
runners

すべりじゃく〔滑り尺〕
〈名〉A sliding rule; a sliding scale

content:
すべる〔滑る、辷る〕
〈自動〉(過って滑る)to slip:(わざと滑る)to slide:(滑るように動く)to glide:(滑り靴で滑る)to skate:(物が滑る)to be slippery

content.content: 滑って転んだ
I slipped and fell.
滑ったり転んだりしてどうかこうか後へ付いた
I stumbled after him.
滑ったり転んだりしてどうやらこうやらここまで漕ぎ付けた
I have struggled through.
滑ったとか転んだとかいう
to make various excuses
滑ったとか転んだとかいって出て来ない
He stays away on various pretexts.
一足滑ったら大変だぞ
A slip, and all is over with you!
屋根から滑り落ちた
I slipped off the roof.
路が凍って滑る
The roads are slippery with ice.
石に青苔が生えて滑る
The stones are slippery with slime.
青苔の生えた石で滑った
I slipped on a slimy stone.
滑るから危ないよ
You will slip! you will slip!
(野球で)塁へ滑り込む
to slide into a base
つい口が滑ったのだ
It was a slip of the tongue―a lapse of the tongue.
筆が滑ったのだ
It was a slip of the pen―a lapse of the pen.
船が青畳を敷いたような海の上を滑り行く
The ship glider over a glassy sea.

すべる〔総べる〕
〈他動〉To control (the affairs of an office); to rule over (a country); to preside over (a department); to superintend (the works); to command (an army, etc.)

content:
ずほう〔図法〕
〈名〉Drawing; draughtsmanship

content.content: 平面図法
projection

content:
ずぼし〔図星〕
〈名〉One's mark; one's design

content.content: 図星にあたる
to hit one's mark
図星を指す
to spot one's design―lay a finger on one's design
彼は図星を指されて白状した
He had his design spotted, and confessed.

content:
すぼまる〔窄まる〕
〈自動〉→『

content.content: すぼむ〔窄む〕

content:
すぼむ〔窄む〕
〈自動〉
1. To become narrower; to shut; to close; to shrink; to collapse

content.content: 徳利の口がすぼんでいる
The bottle is narrow at the mouth―A bottle has a narrow mouth.
傘がすぼむ
An umbrella shuts.
傘のようにすぼむようにできている
It shuts like an umbrella.
風船がすぼむ
A balloon collapses.
この猟銃は先がすぼんでいる
The gun is a choke-bore.

content: 2. (=凋む)to fade

content.content: 花がすぼむ
A flower fades.

content:
すぼめる〔窄める〕
〈他動〉To make (anything) narrower; to shut (an umbrella); to fold(a wing); to pucker up (one's mouth); to purse up (one's lips); to shrug (one's shoulders); to gather (the opening of a sleeve, etc.)

content.content: 傘をすぼめる
to shut an umbrella
鳥が羽根をすぼめる
A bird folds its wings.
口をすぼめる
to pucker up one's mouth―purse up one's lips
肩をすぼめる
to shrug one's shoulders
身をすぼめる
to gather oneself up
身をすぼめて人を通した
I gathered myself up to let a man pass.

content:
ずぼら
〈形〉Slovenly; loose

content.content: あれはずぼらな男だ
He is a sloven.

content:
ズボン
〈名〉Trousers; breeches:(米国にては)pantaloons; pants:(綺麗に言えば)the nether garments; inexpressibles; unmentionables

content.content: スボンをはく
to wear trousers
太いズボン、細いズボン
wide trousers―narrow trousers
ズボンの隠し
a trouser's pocket
君のズボンのボタンがはずれている
“Your stable-door is open.”
ズボンの裾を折り返す
to turn up the ends of the trousers
彼はズボンの裾を折り返している
He has the ends of his trousers turned up.
ズボン下
drawers
ズボン吊り
braces―(は英、米は)―suspenders
ズボン地
trousering

content:
すま〔隅〕
〈名〉→『

content.content: すみ〔隅〕

content:
すまい〔住居〕
〈名〉A dwelling; an abode; a residence; a homestead; a house; a place:(=する) to live

content.content: お住まいはどちらですか
Where do you live?
一家は都の住まい
The family lives in town.
田舎住まい
They live in the country.
宅ではもとから東京住まいです
We have always lived in Tokyo.
住まいを定める
to take up one's abode―settle
宅では祖父の代から東京住まいです
We have lived in Tokyo―We have been settled in Tokyo―since my grandfather's time.
結構なお住まいです
You have quite a home here.

content:
すまう〔住う〕
〈自動〉To live (in a country); to dwell (in a house); to reside (in a mansion); to inhabit (a country); to occupy (a room)

content.content: あの島に人が住まっているか
Is the island inhabited?
人が住まっておらぬ
It is uninhabited.
人の住まった跡がある(跡が無い)
It shows traces of human habitation―shows no trace of human habitation.
住まうなら東京
Tokyo is the only place worth living in.
住まう家
a house to live in―a house in which to live―a dwelling-house

すまし〔済まし〕
〈名〉Clear soup; consomm?

content:
すまじめ〔素真面目〕
〈形〉Matter-of-fact

content.content: あの人は素まじめでしゃれを言ってもわからない
He is a matter-of-fact man, and can not enter into a joke.

content:
すます〔済ます〕
〈他動〉
1. (=仕終る) to finish (one's task); to get through with (one's task); to go through (a ceremony); to get quit of (one's business); to settle (a matter)

content.content: 仕事を済ます
to finish one's work―get through with one's task
仕事を済ましたらすぐ行く
I am coming as soon as I get through with my task.
今日の仕事を済ました
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)I am through for today.
儀式を済ます
to go through a ceremony
儀式をそこそこに済ました
We hurried through the ceremony―The ceremony was hurried through.
試験を済ます
to go through an examination
試験は形式だけに済ますのだ
The examination is gone through for form's sake.
試験を済まして帰省した
Examination over, I went home.
夕飯を済ましたから出かけようじゃないか
Let us go out after supper!
夕飯を済ましてぶらつきに出かけた
Supper over, we went out for a stroll.
用を済ます
to get quit of one's business
この用を済ますと手が空きます
When I am quit of this business, I shall be at leisure.
勘定を済ます
to settle one's account―pay one's reckoning
月末の払いが済ませない
I can not pay my monthly bills.
事を内分に済ますことになりました
It has been decided to settle the matter between ourselves.
こんなことをされてはこのままでは済まされぬ
I can not pass over the matter in silence―I can not let the matter drop―I must demand satisfaction.
このままでは済まされまい
The matter must go on―The matter must proceed.
こりゃ只じゃ済まされん (奢れ奢れ)
I can't let you off for nothing. You must stand treat.
安直に済ましておこう
Let us do it cheap!

content: 2. (=間に合わす) to do (with or without something); to manage (with or without something)

content.content: 君は月百円で済ませるか
Can you do with―manage with get along on―100 yen a month?
独身なら月百円で済ませる
A bachelor can get along on 100 yen a month.
無しに済ます
to do without―manage without―get along without―make shift without―dispense with―spare―anything
当分この金は無しに済ませる
I can do without this money for the present.
女中無しに済ましている家がいくらもある
Many families manage without servants.
女中無しに済ませるかね
Can you get along without a servant?
僕の家では下女無しにどうかこうか済ましている
We make shift without a servant.
僕は女中無しには済ませない
I can't spare a servant.
とうとう金を払わずに済ましたね
You have succeeded in dispensing with payment.
彼は夕飯を食わずに済ますことが往々ある
He has often to go without his supper.

content:
すます〔澄ます〕
〈他動〉
1. (=澄ませる) to clear (water); to clarify (wine)

content.content: 芥を去って水を澄ます
to clear water from impurities
耳を澄ます
to strain one's ears
耳を澄まして十二時打つのを待った
I listened for twelve to strike.
隣室で僕の話を始めたから耳を澄まして聴いた
When they began to talk about me in the next room, I listened intently―I listened with both ears―I was all ears.
彼が演説すると聴衆が耳を澄まして聴く
When he speaks, the audience is all attention.

content:
〈自動〉
1. (=まじめな顔をする) to look grave; to look solemn; to look wise

content.content: 笑わずに澄ましている
to keep one's gravity―keep one's countenance
そのおかしな光景を見て笑わずに澄ましておれなかった
I could not keep my gravity at the sight―The sight upset my gravity.
偉そうに澄ましている
to look wise
いやに澄ましているね
He is as solemn as a judge―He looks provokingly grave.
たいそうお澄ましだね
You look as grave as a judge.

content: 2. (=平気なり) to be calm; to be serene; to be unconcerned; to be indifferent

content.content: 彼はいくら借金があっても澄ましたものだ
With all his debts, he is perfectly calm and serene.
彼らは人の溺死するのを澄まして見ている
They can look on quite unmoved―with perfect unconcern―with the utmost sang-froid―at a drowning man.
彼は息子の訃音に接しても澄ましておった
He received the news of his son's death with perfect unconcern―with perfect indifference―with perfect composure―with perfect nonchalance.
人がいくら騒いでも澄ました顔をして眺めている
People may be ever so much alarmed, but he looks on with an unconcerned air―with a nonchalant air―with an unmoved countenance―without moving a muscle of his face.
ロシアは旅順から日本を追い出しておいて後へ入って澄ましていた
Russia ousted Japan out of Port Arthur, and quietly stepped into her shoes.

content: 3. (=気取る) to put on airs; to give oneself airs; to be affected; to mince

content.content: 彼は澄ましてものを言う
He talks affectedly―minces his words.
澄まして歩く
He struts along―(女なら)―She minces her steps―walks with mincing steps.
女がツンと澄ます
to look prim―assume a prim air―prim
女がからかわれるとツンと澄ましてしまう
When she is made fun of, she prims up.

content: 4. (=成り澄ます)→『

content.content: なりすます〔成り澄ます〕

content:
すまない〔済まない〕
〈打消自動詞〉
1. (原意は) not to be excused; not to be justified:(より) I have done wrong:(普通は) I am sorry

content.content: 済まないことをした
I have done wrong.
人に済まないことをする
to do one wrong
君に済まないことをした
I have done you a wrong.
怠けては主人に済まない
I should do my master wrong to be idle.
そんなことをしては奥さんに済みません
I should do your wife wrong if I were to do such a thing.
そんなことをして奥さんに済みませんね
I have sinned against Madame.
悪い事をしてどうも済みません
I am sorry for what I have done.
お手数をかけて済みません
I am sorry to give you trouble.
こんなに頂戴してどうも済みません
I am sorry to put you to such expense.
済まないと思ったら潔く謝罪する
If you feel sorry for what you have done, acknowledge your fault with a good grace.
彼は済まないと言って謝った
He has acknowledged his fault―expressed his regret for his fault.
遅刻して済みません
I am sorry I am late―I must apologize for my lateness.
ご心配をかけて済みません
I am sorry to have caused you such anxiety.
お忙しいところをお邪魔して済みません
I am sorry to intrude upon your precious time.
本当にそうなら済まないね
If that is true, I am very sorry.
どうも済みませんが傘を借して下さいませんか
I am sorry to trouble you, but will you please lend me an umbrella?
君済まないがその窓を開けてくれんか
May I trouble you to open that window?
済まないが金を少し貸して下さらんか
May I trouble you for some money?
遊んでいては済まない
I have no excuse for being idle―Idleness is a sin.
遊んでいては世間様に済まない
Idleness is a sin against the world.
お前そんなことをしては済まないじゃないか
You should not have done that―You ought not to have done that.
お前はその金を使って済まんことをした
You should not have spent the money.
君にけがでもさせたらご両親に済まない
What should I say to your parents if you should have an accident?
(悪い事をして)済まないと思う
to feel remorse
僕は悪い事をして済まないと思っている
I feel remorse for my crime―My crime weighs on my conscience.
思い出しては済まないことをしたと思っています
I feel remorse at the thought―The thought gives me a pang.
気が済まない
I have an unsatisfied feeling―I feel uneasy.
医者に見て貰わないと気が済まない
I make a conscience of consulting a doctor.
借金を返さないと気が済まない
I make a conscience of―make a point of―paying my debts.
僕は毎日散歩しないと気が済まない
I make a point of taking a walk every day.
それでは気が済まないからぜひこの金を取っておいて下さい
I must insist upon your taking the money.
これをしなけりゃ義務が済まぬ
I shall fail in my duty if I neglect this.
そう言わなければ彼に対して義理が済まぬ
It is due to him to say so.
そうしなけりゃ故人に対して義理が済まぬ
It is due to his memory to do so.

content:
すみ〔隅〕
〈名〉A corner; an angle; a nook

content.content: 生徒を(罰として)隅に立たせる
to put a boy in the corner
彼は隅に小さくなっている
He is crouching in a corner―crouched in a corner.
隅から隅まで
in every nook and corner
隅から隅まで捜した
I have looked in every nook and corner―searched every nook and corner―left no corner unsearched.
彼は隅から隅まで行き届いている
He is attentive to the minutest details―He is thorough-going.
僕はこの辺は隅から隅まで知っている
I know every inch of the ground.
彼はなかなか隅に置けない
He is not to be overlooked―He is not to be sneezed at―He is no chicken.
あんなまじめな顔をしているけれどもなかなか隅に置けない
He looks as grave as a judge, but he is a devil of a fellow.

content:
すみ〔済み〕
〈形〉Settled

content.content: 支払済み
Settled―Paid.
検査済み
Examined―Conditioned.
種痘済み
Vaccinated.

content:
すみ〔酢味〕
〈名〉A sour taste; acidity

content.content: 酢味のある
sour―acid

content:
すみ〔炭〕
〈名〉Charcoal

content.content: 炭をつぐ
to put more charcoal on the fire―feed the fire with charcoal―replenish the fire with charcoal
火鉢に炭をくべろ
Put more charcoal on the fire!
炭になる
to char―be charred
肉が炭になってしまった
The meat is burnt to a cinder.
炭を焼く
to burn charcoal
炭焼き
a charcoal-burner
炭窯
a charcoal-kiln
炭斗
a charcoal-scuttle
炭俵
a charcoal-sack

content:
すみ〔墨〕
〈名〉Ink; Indian ink; Chinese ink:(磨らない墨は) an ink-stick

content.content: 墨を磨る
to rub down an ink-stick
筆に墨を付ける
to dip a brush in ink
墨で書く
to write with brush and ink
真の闇夜に
It is a pitch-dark night―
桜を削り
The cherry he doth pare,
赤き心を
And lays his red heart bare
墨で書く
In words of black and white.
墨が濃い、墨が薄い
The ink is thick―The ink is thin.
墨黒々と書いてある
It is written with bold strokes―written in a bold hand.
一天墨を流すが如し
The sky is as black as ink.
墨を引く
to draw the brush through a line―strike out a line―(帳消しの意味なら)―settle accounts―cancel accounts
額に墨を塗る
to besmear one's face with ink
負けた者は顔に墨を塗られる
One who is beaten has his face besmeared with ink.
君の額に墨が付いている
Your face is stained with ink―There is an ink-stain on your face.
墨だらけの顔
a face besmeared all over with ink
墨絵
a painting in black and white
墨一挺
a cake of ink―an ink-stick
烏賊の墨
the ink of the cuttlefish―sepia
烏賊が墨を吹く
A cuttlefish ejects its ink.

すみいし〔墨石〕
〈名〉A corner-stone; a quoin

content:
すみいろ〔墨色〕
〈名〉The colour of ink

content.content: 墨色判断
graphology

すみえ〔墨絵〕
〈名〉A painting in black and white; an aquarelle

content:
すみきり〔隅切り〕
〈名〉A bevelled square

content.content: 墨切り窓
a bevelled window

content:
すみごこち〔住心地〕
〈名〉

content.content: この辺は住心地が好さそうだ
The place seems comfortable to live in.
住み心地の好い家
a comfortable house

content:
すみこみ〔住込み〕
〈名〉Living in

content.content: 住み込みですか通いですか
Do you live in or out?
住み込みです
I live in―I sleep on the premises.

content:
すみこむ〔住込む〕
〈自動〉To enter one's service; to take service (with a family)

content.content: 家庭教師に住み込む
to enter a family as governess
家庭教師に住み込んでいる
She lives with a family as governess―She is installed as governess.
女中に住み込む
to take service with a family as maid-servant
西洋人の家に女中に住み込んでいる
She lives with a foreigner as maid-servant.
彼は書生に住み込んだ
He entered a family as boy.
外国人の家に書生に住み込んでいる
He lives with a foreigners as boy.

content:
すみずみ〔隅々〕
〈名〉Every nook and corner

content.content: 隅々まで捜した
I have looked in every nook and corner―searched every nook and corner―left no corner unsearched.
彼は隅々まで行届いている
He is attentive to the minutest details―He is thorough-going.
僕はこの辺は隅々まで知っている
I know every inch of the ground.

content:
すみぞめ〔墨染め〕
〈形〉Ink-dyed; black

content.content: 墨染の衣
a black robe

すみちがい〔隅違い〕
〈形〉Diagonal:(=に) diagonally

content:
すみつき〔墨付き〕
〈名〉
1. (=墨の付き工合) receptivity for ink

content.content: 墨付きの好い紙だ
The paper takes ink well.

content:
2. (=官文書) an official document
3. (=辞令) a writ of appointment
4. (=墨印) a black seal

すみっこ〔隅っこ〕
〈名〉A corner

content.content: 彼は隅っこに小さくなっていた
He was crouching in a corner―crouched in a corner.

すみつぼ〔墨壺〕
〈名〉An inkstand:(大工のは) an ink-pot

content:
すみなれる〔住み慣れる〕
〈他動〉To get used to living in (a place)

content.content: 住み慣れた処
a place where one has lived long
住み慣れた家
one's old house―one's beloved home
住み慣れた故郷を後にして行く
I leave my beloved home behind me.

すみなわ〔墨縄〕
〈名〉A (carpenter's) inking line

content:
すみひき〔墨引き〕
〈名〉Settling accounts

content.content: 墨引き(帳消し)にする
to settle accounts―cancel accounts―square accounts―cross off accounts―with some one
これで墨引きになる(貸借無しになる)
This will make the accounts even―make all even―make all square.

content:
すみやか〔速か〕
〈形〉
1. (=早い) rapid; swift; fast; quick; prompt; speedy:(=に) rapidly; swiftly; fast; quickly; promptly; speedily; with celerity; with despatch; with expedition

content.content: 工事は速やかに進行しつつあり
The works are making rapid progress.
何でも問われたなら速やかに返答する
You must make a prompt reply to any question.
この薬の効き目は速かだ
The action of the medicine is swift.

content: 2. (=に) (=じきに、すぐに) soon; immediately; speedily; at once; without delay

content.content: 事件は速やかに落着せんことを祈る
I wish the matter would come to a speedy conclusion.
速やかにご回答あらんことを乞う
I request you will give me an early answer.
速やかに一本を座右に備え給え
Procure a copy without delay!

content:
すみやき〔炭焼き〕
〈名〉A charcoal-burner

content.content: 炭焼老爺
an old charcoal-burner

content:
すみれ〔菫〕
〈名〉The violet

content.content: 三色菫
the pansy―the heart's ease
虫取り菫
the butterwort
菫色
violet

content:
すみわたる〔澄み渡る〕
〈自動〉To become pellucid; to become limpid

content.content: 澄み渡った空
the pellucid sky―the limpid air
月が澄み渡る
The moon shines serene.
澄み渡った月
a serene moon

content:
すむ〔済む〕
〈自動〉
1. (=終る) to end, come to an end, be brought to an end; to come to a close, be brought to a close; to come to a termination be brought to a termination; to come to a conclusion, be brought to a conclusion; to be finished; to be completed; to be settled; to be done; to be over; to be at an end

content.content: この戦争は いつ済むだろうか
When will this war come to an end?
戦争が済んだ
The war is at an end―The war is over.
試験が済んで愉快だろう
Are you not glad that the examination is over?
試験が済んでから帰省した
The examination over, I went home.
仕事が済んだ
My work is done―(他動詞構文にすれば)―I have finished my work―I am through with my work.
今日の仕事が済んだ
I have finished my day's work―(は英、米は)―I am through for today!
夕飯がお済みですか
Is your supper over?―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Have you had your supper?
夕飯が済んでから出かけよう
Let us go out after supper.
夕飯が済んでからぶらつきに出かけた
Supper over, we went out for a stroll.
ご馳走はお済みですか
Have you finished your dinner?
勘定が済んだ
The account is settled―The reckoning is paid.
お勘定はまだ済みません
Your account is not yet settled.
この洋服の代がまだ済まない
The coat is not yet paid for.
事が済んだ
The matter is settled.
事は内分に済んだ
The matter has been settled between ourselves.
授受が済んだ
The delivery is completed.
用が済んだ
I have finished my business―I am through with my business―I am quit of the business.
用が済んだらさっさと帰って来い
When your business is over, come away at once!
この本はご用が済みましたか
Have you done with the book?
用が済みました
I have done with it.
いま一ページ書くと済む
One more page, and I have done.
いま一時間で済む
One more hour, and it is over.
君は徴兵検査が済んだか
Have you gone through the examination for conscription?
うちの子どもらは麻疹{はしか}が済んでいる
Our children have had the measles.
君は種痘が済んだか
Have you been vaccinated?
これで借金が済む
This will clear off my debts.
済んだことはしかたがない
What is done, can not helped―What is done, can not be undone―What is done, is done.

content: 2. (=無事に済む) to go off (without mishap); to get off (without injury); to pass off (without disturbance); to come off (unscathed); to escape (unhurt)

content.content: 儀式は無事に済んだ、首尾好く済んだ
The ceremony has gone off without a hitch―gone of very well.
二百十日も無事に済んだ
The critical day has passed off calmly.
婚礼もめでたく済んだ
The wedding has gone off merrily.
事は無事に済んだ、大事に至らずして済んだ
The affair came to nothing―Nothing came of the affair.
けが無しに済んだ
I got off without a scratch―got off with a whole skin―escaped skin-whole―came off unscathed.
微傷で済んだ
I got off with a scratch or two.
少しの損で済んだ
I got off with a little loss.
損をせずに済んだ
I got off without any loss―I escaped loss.
罰金で済んだ
I got off with a fine.
罰金を払わずに済んだ
I got off without paying a fine.
君はそうやすくは済まないぞ
You can not get off so easily.
三年以下では済まないぞ
You can not get off under three years.
(そんなうまいことをして)只じゃ済まないぞ(奢れ、奢れ)
You can't get off for nothing. You must stand treat.

content: 3. (=間に合う用が足りる) to do (the business); to answer the purpose; to serve one's turn

content.content: 金で済む事ならいくらでも出す
If money will do the business, I will give any sum.
何紙でも済む
Any paper will do―answer the purpose―serve my turn.
安直に済むだろう
It may be done quite cheap.
無くて済む
to do without―manage without―get along without―make shift without―dispense with―spare―anything
当分この金が無くとも済む
I can do without this money for the present.
女中が無くて済んでいる家はいくらでもある
Many families manage without servants.
僕の家では女中が無くても済んでいる
We make shift without a servant.
君は女中が無くて済むか
Can you get along without a servant?
僕は女中が無くては済まん
I can't spare a servant.
とうとう金を払わずに済んだね
You have succeeded in dispensing with payment.

content: 4. (=何々せず済む) need not (do something); to avoid (doing something); to escape (doing something); can help (doing something)

content.content: 学校を止めずに済みます
I need not leave school.
学校を止めずに済んだ
I have avoided leaving school―I have managed not to leave school.
徴兵に取られずに済む
I need not serve in the army.
徴兵に行かずに済んだ
I have escaped military service―missed being a soldier.
徴兵に行かずには済まない
I can not help serving in the army―I can not but serve in the army―I must serve in the army.
金を借りずに済まぬ(借りざるを得ぬ)
I can not help borrowing money.
金を借りずに済むなら借りはせぬ
I would not borrow money if I could help it.
学校を休まずに済むなら休みはせぬ
I do not absent myself from school if I can help it.
敵に目的を達せしめずに済んだ
We have succeeded in frustrating the enemy's design.

content: 5. (=気が済む) to be satisfied; to be appeased

content.content: (これをして)気が済んだ
My heart is satisfied―My conscience is appeased.
借金を返して気が済んだ
The payment of the debt has appeased my conscience.
気が済まない
I have an unsatisfied feeling―I feel uneasy.
悪いことをして気が済まない
I feel remorse for my crime―My crime weighs on my conscience.
医者に見て貰わないと気が済まない
I make a conscience of consulting a doctor.
借金を払わないと気が済まない
I make a conscience of―make a point of―paying my debts.
僕は毎日散歩しないと気が済まない
I make a point of taking a walk every day.
それでは気が済まないからぜひこの金を取って置いて下さい
I must insist on your taking the money.
これをしなけりゃ義務が済まぬ
I shall fail in my duty if I neglect it.
こう言わなけりゃ彼に対して義理が済まぬ
It is due to him to say so.

content: 6. (=差支無い) to be justified; to be excused

content.content: そんなことをして済むと思うか
Do you think you can be excused for doing such a thing?―Can you excuse yourself for doing such a thing?―Can you justify yourself for doing such a thing?
こんな失錯をしておいて済むも済まないもあるものか
How can you excuse yourself for committing such a blunder?
いや間違いくらいでは済まぬ
The plea of a mistake can not excuse your conduct.
お詫びをすれば済む
An apology will set the matter right.
(こんなことをされては)このままでは済まぬ
I can not pass over the matter in silence―I can not let the matter drop―I must demand satisfaction.
このままで済むまい
The matter must go on.
すまない〔済まない〕

content:
すむ〔住む〕
〈自動〉To live (in a country); to dwell (in a house); to reside (in a mansion); to inhabit (a country); to occupy (a house); to people, populate (a country)

content.content: 地球上に住む動物はいく種類あるか
How many kinds of animals live on the earth?―inhabit the earth?
アイヌ人はもと本州に住んでいた
The Ainos formerly lived in the Main Island―inhabited the Main Island―The Main Island was formerly peopled by the Ainos―populated by the Ainos.
この家に誰が住んでいるか
Who lives in this house?―Who occupies this house?
この家に住んでいる人は誰か
Who is the occupant of this house?―the tenant of this house?
この家は人が住んだことがあるか
Has this house been lived in?
この家は人が住んだことが無い
The house has never been lived in.
住む家
a house to live in―a house in which to live
あの島は人が住んでいるか
Is the island inhabited?
人が住んでいない
The island is uninhabited.
人の住んだ跡がある(跡が無い)
It shows traces of human habitation―shows no trace of human habitation.
人間の住める処じゃない
It is not fit for human habitation.
都に住む人は田舎の快楽を知らぬ
Men living in towns do not know the pleasures of the country.
アラビア人は天幕に住む
The Arabs dwell in tents.
西洋人は宏壮な邸宅に住んでいる
The foreigners reside in magnificent mansions.
住まば東京
Tokyo is the only place worth living in.
見苦しくとも住めば都
“Home is home, be it ever so homely.”

content:
すむ〔澄む〕
〈自動〉To become clear; to clear; to clarify

content.content: 水が澄む
Water clears.
酒が澄む
Wine clarities.
月が澄む
The moon shines serene.
独楽が澄む
A top sleeps.
この河の水はいつも澄んでいる
The water of this river is always clear (from mud).
水晶澄みに澄んでいる
The water is clear as crystal―crystal clear.
澄んだ水
clear water―crystal water
澄んだ流れ
a limpid stream―a pellucid stream
澄んだ空
the pellucid sky―the limpid air
澄んだ月
a clear moon―a serene moon

content:
すめくら〔素盲目〕
〈名〉Utter blindness

content.content: あの人は素盲目だ
He is utterly blind―as blind as a mole.

content.content: すめらぎ〔天皇〕

content:
すもう〔相撲、角力〕
〈名〉
1. Wrestling

content.content: 相撲を取る
to wrestle (with an adversary)
相撲を一番取る
to have a turn at wrestling―have a wrestling bout―try a fall
人の褌で相撲を取る
to be generous at another's expense―“rob Peter to pay Paul”
二人に相撲を取らせる
to match the two against each other―pitch the two against each other
あの二人に相撲を取らしたら面白かろう
It would be interesting to match them against each other.
こりゃ相撲にならぬ
The one is no match for the other.
相撲の勝負
a wrestling-match―a wrestling-bout―a fall
相撲に勝つ、相撲に負ける
to win a bout―lose a bout
相撲は預かりになった
The match was not decided.
相撲が分けになった
The match ended in a draw.
相撲が立つ
Wrestling-matches are held.
相撲を興行する
to hold wrestling-matches
相撲の勧進元
the promoter of wrestling-matches
相撲を見に行った
I went to see the wrestling-matches.
国技館の大相撲
the Annual Matches at the Kokugikan
花相撲
prize-wrestling matches
坐り相撲
sedentary wrestling
独り相撲
wrestling by oneself
腕相撲
wrestling with the arm
足相撲
wrestling with the leg
相撲の手
a wrestling-trick―a chip
相撲の取り組み
a match
相撲取り
a wrestler
相撲の相手
an adversary
相撲の相手を投げる
to fling an adversary―give one a fall

content: 2. (=相撲取り) a wrestler

content.content: 君のひいきの相撲は誰か
Who is your favourite wrestler?
あの相撲はいつも勝つ(いつも負ける)
That wrestler always comes off a winner―comes off a loser.
好い体格だ、相撲にしたらよいだろう
He has a fine physique. What a wrestler he will make!
相撲を立ち会わせる
to match one wrestler against another―pitch one wrestler against another
相撲協会
the Wrestlers' Association

an unglazed jar―a porous pot

〈副〉Calmly; peacefully

content.content: 子どもがスヤスヤ寝ている
The child is sleeping calmly―How peacefully the child sleeps!

content:
すら
〈副〉Even; (not) so much as (do something):(代用形容詞) the very:(代用代名詞)oneself

content.content: 鬼神ですら泣く
Even the gods cry―The very gods cry―The gods themselves cry―Even the very gods themselves cry.
彼は読み書きすらできない
He can not so much as read and write.

ずらかる
〈自動〉To run away; to fly; to escape; to decamp; to abscond

ずらす
〈他動〉To work down (the trousers, etc.)

content:
スラスラ
〈副〉Smoothly; easily; fluently; readily; swimmingly; glidingly; without a hitch; without an effort

content.content: 彼はスラスラと英語を話す
He speaks English fluently.
スラスラと(淀み無く)物語った
He told the story off the reel―without a hitch in the memory.
君が加盟さえすれば事がスラスラ運ぶ
If you will only join the concern, the matter will go on swimmingly―go on wheels.
彼は手紙をスラスラと書き流した
He dashed off a letter.
何を問われてもスラスラと返答する
He gives ready answers to any questions.
船が海面をスラスラと走る
The ship glides over the sea.
彼はスラスラと本が読める
He can read any book without stopping to spell.
彼はどんな難問でもスラスラと解決する
He solves the hardest questions without an effort.

content:
すらりと〔スラリと〕
〈副〉Smoothly; easily

content.content: スラリとできた
It was done with ease.
スラリと刀を抜く
to whip out a sword
スラリとした姿だ
He has a slender figure―He has a clean-formed figure―He is a clean-limbed man.

content.content: 本は今刷りにかけてある

この本は刷りが好い、刷りが悪い
The book is well printed―badly printed.

content:

content.content: 僕はスリにやられた
I have had my pocket picked.
スリに時計をやられた
I had my pocket picked of a watch.
スリご用心
Beware of pickpockets―(は米、英は)―The public is cautioned against pickpockets.
スリ連
the light-fingered gentry
紳士ふうをしたスリ仲間
the swell mob

ズリ
〈名〉(=印刷のズリ)A slur

content.content: 一日に一万部刷り上げる

a newspaper wet from the press

a changeling

content.content: 縄が岩角に擦れて擦り切れそうだ
The rope is chafing against an angle of rock and wearing through.
筆が擦り切れた
The brush is worn to a stump.

mortar and pestle

content.content: 擦り半だ、火事は近いぞ

to bark one's shins

content:
すりよる〔擦り寄る〕
〈他動〉To draw closer to (one); to nestle to (one); to nestle close to (one); to snuggle up to (one); to muzzle to (one); to edge up to (one); to sidle up to (one)

content.content: 二人は互いにすり寄って小耳で話していた
The two had drawn close to each other, and were talking in whispers.
子どもが怖がってすり寄って来た
The frightened child nestled close to me.

content:
する〔為る〕
〈他動〉
1. (=為る)to do

content.content: 仕事をする
to do one's work―do one's task―perform one's task
どうすればよいのか
What do you wish me to do?―What would you have me do?
僕がするようにするさ
Do as I do?
命じたことをしたか
Have you done what I told you to?―Have you obeyed my orders?
君はすることが有るか
Have you anything to do?
することが無い
I have nothing to do.
僕はすることがたくさん有る
I have many things to do.
君は何をしているか
What are you doing?―What are you at?―What are you about?―How are you engaged?
彼は何もせずにいる
He is doing nothing.
すべきことをする
to do one's duty
人は何と言おうとも僕はするだけのことはする
Whatever others may say, I will do my duty.
悪いことをする
to do evil―commit a crime
そんなことをするものか
I'm damned if I do―I'm blest if I do.
商売をする
to do business―carry on trade―prosecute a trade

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 散歩をする
to take a walk
旅行する
to make a journey
学問をする
to prosecute one's studies―pursue knowledge
戦争をする
to wage war
相談をする
to take counsel
人と話をする
to talk with one
すること為すこと皆手違い
Everything went wrong with me.
彼はどんな悪いこともしかねない男だ
He is capable of anything.
人に笑われないようにせよ
See that people do not laugh at you!
こういう時にはどうすればよいものか
How shall I act―conduct myself― on such occasions?［注意］その他ほとんど無限。

content: 2. (=何をどうする、処分する、処置する) what to do with (anything)

content.content: この子をどうしようか(棄てようか棄てまいか)
What shall I do with this child?
あの金をどうしたか
What have you done with the money?
この品物をどうするつもりか(売るか売らぬか)
What are you going to do with these goods?―How do you intended to dispose of these goods?
ご次男をどうするお考えか
What are you going to do with your second boy?―What are your intentions with regard to your second son?

content: 3. (=人を何にする)to make (one something―something of or out of one)

content.content: あの女を女房にする気か
Are you going to make her your wife?
君を教師にする
(教師に頼むのなら)I will make you a teacher―(教師に仕立てるのなら)―make a teacher of you.
親父は僕を医者にする考えだ
My father intends to make a physician of me―My father intends me for a physician.
伯(叔)父は僕を一人前の人間にすると言っています
My uncle promises to make a man of me.
あの小僧を物にするつもりだ
I will make something out of the boy yet.

content: 4. (=何を何にする、変ずる)to change, turn, make (one thing into another)

content.content: 工場で原料を製品にする
A factory changes raw materials into manufactured goods―makes raw materials into manufactured goods.
品物を金にすることができるか
Can I turn some goods into money?
(往古のいわゆる)煉金術家が鉄や銅を黄金にすると言った
The alchemists professed to turn iron or copper into gold.
理を非にする
to talk right into wrong

content: 5. (=何の役をする)(人なら)to act as, officiate as, functionate as (something):(物なら)serve as, do duty as (something)

content.content: 俺が仲人をしよう
I will act as go-between.
誰が審判官をするか
Who will act as umpire?―be umpire?―see fair play?
あの中学校は誰が校長をしているか
Who is principal of that middle school?
彼が東京府知事をしていた時のことだ
It happened when he was governor of Tokyo.［注意］官名にあらざれば冠詞を略さず。例えば
彼は新聞記者をして居る
He is a journalist.
新聞配達をしている
He is a newsboy.
医者の書生をしている
He is a doctor's boy.
米屋をしている
He is rice-dealer.
この箱は食卓の役をする
This box serves as―does duty as―a table.

content: 6. (=いくらする、価する) to cost (so much)

content.content: 君の洋服はいくらしたか
What did your coat cost you?―What did you give for your coat?
五十円した
It cost me fifty yen―I gave fifty yen for it.
良い馬はいくらするか
What does a good horse cost?― What must one give for a good horse?
良い馬は二三百円はする
A good horse costs two or three hundred yen―One must give two or three hundred yen for a good horse.

content:
する〔刷る〕
〈他動〉To print (a book); to put (a book) in print; to print off, strike off, work off, run off (so many copies)

content.content: 本は今刷っている
The book is printing―in the press―going through the press.
何部刷りますか
How many copies do you print off?
一回に一万部ずつ刷ります
We strike off 10,000 copies at a time.
この機械で新聞が一時間に三万枚刷れる
This press can work off―run off―30,000 newspapers in an hour.

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: この新聞は何枚刷りますか
How many copies of the paper do you issue?
この雑誌は十万刷るそうだ
They issue 100,000 copies of the magazine, I hear.
名刺を刷って貰いたい
I want to have some cards made.
何枚刷りましょうか
How many copies do you want?
百枚刷って下さい
I want a hundred copies.

He wields an incisive pen―a trenchant pen.

He possesses incisive speech―trenchant speech.

content: 2. (=鋭敏な) acute (intellect); keen (sense); sharp (intelligence); quick, piercing, penetrating (eve); astute (politician); nice (judgment); fine (sense, etc.)

content.content: 彼は鋭い人間だ
He is an astute man―a sharp fellow.
非常に鋭い
He is as sharp as a needle.
鋭い頭脳を持っている

He has keen senses―quick senses―fine senses.
目が鋭い、眼光が鋭い
He has a keen eye―a sharp eye―a quick eye―a piercing eye―a penetrating eye.
犬は鼻が鋭い
The dog has a keen sense of smell―a fine sense of smell.
彼は神経が鋭い
He is very nervous―all nerves.
神経が鋭くなった
I have a fit of nerves―My nerves are on end.
日本人は廉恥心{れんちしん}が鋭い
The Japanese are keenly alive to the sense of honour.

content:

〈副〉Very nearly; well nigh

content.content: 僕はすんでの事にこの崖から落ちるところであった

I very nearly fell over this precipice―well nigh fell over this precipice―came near falling over this precipice―came within an inch of falling over this precipice―just missed falling over this precipice.
僕はすんでの事にあの河で死ぬところであった
I came near being drowned―just missed being drowned―in that river.

A motor-car very nearly ran over me―well nigh ran over me―came near running over me―went near to run over me―just missed running over me.
両船がすんでの事に衝突するところであった
The ships were very nearly running foul of each other―in imminent danger of colliding with each other.
彼はすんでの事にその書類を火中するところであった

僕はすんでの事にその名を言うところであった
I was on the point of uttering his name,―His name was on the tip of my tongue,―when I suddenly recollected myself.

measurements

content:

1. (=早瀬)rapids

content.content: それじゃ僕の立つ瀬が無いじゃないか
Then where do I come in?
いつか浮かぶ瀬があろう
I shall come to the surface―rise in the world―some time.
身を捨ててこそ浮かぶ瀬もあれ
“Risk all and gain all.”
昨日の淵は今日の瀬
Life is liable to vicissitudes.

content:

〈名〉The back

content.content: 本の背
the back of a book
山の背
the ridge of a mountain
背に腹は替えられぬ
“Close sits my shirt, but closer sits my skin”―“Needs must when the devil drives.”

content:
ぜ
〈間投詞〉I can tell you; I assure you

content.content: 骨が折れるぜ
It is hard work, I can tell you.
これは本当だぜ
I assure you that this is true.

content:
ぜ〔是〕
〈名〉Right

content.content: 是か非か
Is it right or wrong?
天道是か非か
(Is Providence right or wrong?―と言わずして)Is there Divine justice in the world?
天道是か非かと叫ぶ
to accuse Heaven of injustice→『ぜがひでも〔是が非でも〕』
この処置を是とする者あり非とする者あり
Some say the measure is right, others say it is wrong―Some approve of the measure, others disapprove of it.
是を是として非を非とする
to call right right and wrong wrong―consider a matter on its own merits
是を是として非を非とするに何かはばからん
What can deter me from calling right right and wrong wrong?
昨の是にして今の非なるを覚ゆ
I feel that what was right yesterday is wrong today.
昨是今非、昨非今是
vacillation

content:
せい
〈形〉(何のせい)(it is) all owing to, due to, attributable to, through, the result of, the effects of (some cause); (it) comes of, results from (some cause)

content.content: 陽気のせいだ
It is due to the weather.
陽気のせいでのぼせる
I am feverish owing to the weather.
君の病気は陽気のせいだろう
You must be under the weather.
陽気のせいで花が開く
The flowers open under the influence of the weather.
彼が怠けるのを陽気のせいにしている
He attributes his idleness to the weather.
お年のせいだ
It is due to your age―Your age is telling on you.
年のせいか物忘れして困る
Whether owing to my age, my memory begins to fail me―(単文にすれば)―Age begins to tell on my memory.
物忘れなさるのはお年のせいでしょう
Your forgetfulness must be due to your age―It must come of your age.
物忘れするのは年のせいだと思った
I attributed my forgetfulness to my age.
君の病気は勉強が過ぎるせいだ
Your illness is the effects of overwork.
彼の病気は炎天に曝されたせいだ
He is suffering from the effects of exposure to the sun.
なーに、飲み過ぎるせいだ
Why, it comes of drinking too much―it is the result of over-indulgence in wine.
僕が失敗したのは君のせいだ
It is all owing to you that I have failed―It is all through you that I have failed―You are responsible for my failure―I must thank you for my failure―I owe you my failure.
彼は失敗したのは君のせいだと言っている
He imputes his failure to you―lays his failure at your door―lays his failure to your charge.
気のせいか数がめっきり増えたようだ
It may be fancy, but the number seems to have perceptibly increased.
そりゃ全く気のせいだ
It is all fancy.

content:
せい〔世〕

〈名〉
1. (=制度)a system; an organization; an institution

to pay one by the hour

the organization of cities, towns, and villages

content: 2. (=支配)rule; sway

content.content: 日本無かりせば支那はロシアの制を受くるに至りしならん

content:

content:

content:

〈名〉
1. (=本性)nature

content.content: 彼は性至って学を好む

Man is born good.

content: 2. (=男女の性)sex:(文法にては)gender

content.content: 男性
the male sex―the sterner sex―(文法にては)―the masculine gender
女性
the female sex―the fair sex―the gentle sex―the softer sex―the weaker sex―(文法にては)―the feminine gender
男女両性
both sexes―the sexes―(形容詞に用いれば)―hermaphrodite
通性
the common gender
無性
the neuter gender―(形容詞に用いれば)―asexual
性の慾

knowledge of the sexes
日本の学童は性の知識がある(色気がある)と西洋人が言う
Foreigners say that Japanese school-children know the sexes.
性的
sexual
日本人は性的に早熟だ
Japanese are sexually precocious―Japanese know the sexes early.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=正義)justice:(wrong に対し)right:(vice に対し)virtue

content.content: 正と邪を区別する
to distinguish between right and wrong
結局邪は正に勝たず
Right prevails over wrong―Virtue triumphs over vice―in the end.

content: 2. (=正本)an exemplified copy; the original document

content.content: 正副二通
original and copy―duplicate copies
書類は正副二通に作成する

content: 2. (=負に対し)plus; positive

content.content: 正数

content:
せい〔生〕
〈名〉Life

content.content: 生を享く
to enjoy life―live
生を享くる物
a living thing
およそ生を享くるものは生を愛す
Life is dear to all living things.
生を全うする
to save one's life
生ある者は必ず死す
“Life is subject to decay.”
生は死の始め
“Birth is, in a sense, the beginning of death.”
死は易く生は難し
It is easy to die for one's faith; it is hard to live up to it.

content:

〈名〉
1. (=精霊)a spirit

content.content: 火の精

the gnome

content: 2. (=精気、精粋)essense; quintessence

the essense of roses―the attar of roses―the otto of roses

content: 3. (=精力)energy; strength; might; nature

content.content: 精が尽きた
Nature is exhausted.
精が尽きると人は死ぬ
When nature fails, a man dies.
精が切れてばったり倒れた

content: 4. (=出精)diligence; industry; effort

content.content: 精を出す
to put forth one's efforts―work hard―put on steam
精を出して働く
to work hard

to work hard―study with diligence
もっと精を出さないと落第するぞ
If you do not work harder, you will fail.

How hard you are working!―You are hard at work.

goods of foreign manufacture―goods of foreign make

These goods are of Japanese manufacture―of Japanese make―Japanese made―made in Japan.
品は極上製です

content: 2. (=製本)binding

content:
せい〔背〕
〈名〉
1. Stature; height

content.content: 西洋人は背が高い
Foreigners are tall.
日本人は背が低い
Japanese are short of stature.
背の高い人、背の低い人
a tall man―a short man
君は背はいくらあるか
How many feet do you stand?
背は五尺五寸あります
I stand five feet six.
彼は背が跣足で六尺ある
He stands six feet in stockings.
背は人並みだ
He is of an average height.
背が伸びる
to grow tall―grow taller
君はたいそう背が伸びたね
How tall you have grown!
人と背を比べる
to measure oneself with another
どんぐりの背比べた(似たり寄ったり)
There is nothing to choose between the two―They are six of one and half-a-dozen of the other―(は二人、三人以上なら)―They are all of a sort―much of a muchness.
この河は背が立つか
Can one wade across this river?
背が立たない
It is too deep to wade across.
そこは背が立つか
Do you feel the bottom?
背が立たない
I do not feel the bottom―I am off the bottom.
彼は背の立たない処へ行くと泳げなかった
When he got out of his depth, he could not swim.
背の立たない処へ行くな(背の立つ処におれ)
Do not go out of your depth!―Keep within your depth!

content:

content.content: 税を納める

税を遁れる

国税

content: 2. (=暮らし)living; livelihood; subsistence:(=する) to live; to subsist

content.content: 生活の道を立てる
to live―subsist―get along―get one's living―make a living―gain one's livelihood―earn one's bread―make the pot boil―keep the pot boiling
子どもに生活の道を立ててやる
to provide for one's children
彼はどうして生活しているか
How does he live?―How does he get his living?―How does he gain his livelihood?―How does he earn his bread?
働いて生活している
He works for his living―works for his bread.
商売をして生活している
He lives by his trade.
筆で生活している
He lives by the pen―writes for a living.
雑誌を書いて生活している
He lives by writing for the magazines.
英語を教えて生活している
He lives by teaching English.
給料で生活している
He lives on his salary.
僅かばかりの金を貰って生活している
He lives on a pittance.
彼はあの薄給でどうして生活ができるかしら
I wonder how he can live on such scanty pay.
いくらあったら生活ができるか
What can you live on?―get along on?
月百円あれば生活ができる
One can live on―get along on―100 yen a month.
君は生活し得るだけ取れるか
Can you get enough to live on?
彼は免職になったら差し当たり生活に困るだろう
If he loses his place, he will have nothing to live on.
彼らは慈善家の扶助を受けて生活している
They subsist on charity.
日本の貧民は慈善家の扶助を受けぬ
In Japan, the poor do not live on charity.
僕は友人の扶助を受けて生活するのはいやだ
I do not like to subsist on the bounty of my friends.
彼は立派に生活している
He makes a good living.
かなりに生活している
He makes a fairly good living―cracks a tidy crust.
かながな生活している
He makes a bare living.
どうかこうか生活している
He manages to live―rubs along somehow.
どうなりこうなり生活ができれば結構だ
We must be content if we can get along anyhow.
未亡人は賃仕事をしてささやかな生活をしている
The widow picks up a scanty livelihood by needlework.
ぜいたくな生活
high living
ぜいたくな生活をする
to live high―live in luxury―live in clover
上等の生活をする、派手な生活をしている
He lives in style.
倹約な生活をする
to live frugally―live on sixpence a day
見分相応の生活をする
to live within one's means―conform oneself to one's fortunes―cut one's coat according to one's cloth
見分不相応な生活をする
to live above one's means
安楽に生活する
to live at one's ease―(は不如意無く、衣食に不自由無くなら)―live in comfort
彼は隠居して安楽に生活している
He has retired from active life, and lives at his ease.
月百円あれば安楽に生活することができる
One can live in comfort on 100 yen a month.
彼は生活が楽だ
He is in easy circumstances―well off.
生活が困難だ
He is in straitened circumstances―badly off.
彼は生活に不自由は無い
He lives in comfort―lives at his ease.
生活に不自由している、生活に困っている
He has nothing to live on―He has no means of livelihood―He wants the necessaries of life.
生活に無くてならぬもの
the necessaries of life
生活するにいくらかかるか
What does living cost?
生活だけに月五十円はかかる
Living alone costs fifty yen a month.
生活費
cost of living
生活難
difficulty of living―high cost of living
生活問題
the question of living―the living problem
生活態度
the standard of living―the style of living
生活の資
means of livelihood―means of subsistence

政権を同うしている
They hold the same political views.
彼は極端の政見を懐いている
He holds extreme views in politics.
政見を発表する
to declare one's political views

the teachings of the sages

〈名〉A common saying; a proverb

content:
せいげん〔制限〕
〈名〉Restriction; limitation; confinement; circumscription; restraint; bounds; limits:(=する) to restrict (a man to some diet); to limit (one's studies to certain subjects); to bound (one's desires to one's means); to confine (oneself to one); to circumscribe (one's activity); to restrain (one's freedom); to set bounds to (one's progress); to set limits to (one's desires)

content.content: 医者にビール一本と制限された
My doctor has restricted me to one bottle of beer.
労働時間は八時間に制限すべきである
The labour day should be limited to eight hours.
生徒数は一千名に制限されている
The number of students is limited to 1,000.
外国語を修めるならすべからく一カ国に制限すべきである
If you wish to master foreign languages, you should confine yourself to one.
人の欲望は制限し難し
It is hard to set bounds to―set limits to―one's desires.
欲望は各自の資力だけに(資力の範囲内に)制限すべきものである
Each man should bound his desire to his means―bound his desires within the limits of one's means.
人の活動は事情によって制限される
Circumstances circumscribe a man's activity―restrain a man's activity.
制限を設ける
to place anything under restriction―impose a restriction upon anything
制限を設けて人を拘束する
to lay a man under restriction―tie his hands
今に出産に制限を設ける必要を生じるだろう
We shall soon have to impose a restriction upon the birth of children.
産児制限
birth-control
軍事制限
armament limitation
輸入制限、輸出制限
restraint on import―restraint on export
年齢の制限は二十歳より四十歳まで
The age limits are from twenty to forty years.
制限法
restrictive system
(紙幣の)制限発行法
limited issue system
紙幣を制限内に発行する
to issue paper-money within the (legal) limit
紙幣を制限外に発行する
to issue paper-money beyond the (legal) limit―over-issue paper-money
制限外発行
excess issue―over-issue
(紙幣発行の)制限説
restriction theory
(貨幣の)制限鋳造
limited coinage
(代価の)制限委託
limited consignment
制限付法貨
limited legal tender
(特別仕立の)制限列車
a limited train
(手形の)制限引受
qualified acceptance
制限裏書
qualified endorsement
速力制限
the speed limit
制限速度
regulation speed
自動車は制限速度で走る
The motor-cars run at regulation speed.

〈名〉［数学］A sine

content.content: 該記事は事実無根に就き正誤相成度候
I request you will correct the statement which is unfounded.
謹んで正誤致します
I respectfully correct myself.
(本の)正誤表
errata
正誤すべき誤謬
a corrigendum―(複数)―corrigenda

content.content: 生後二カ月の赤児
a two-month-old baby

せいこう〔性行〕
〈名〉Character and conduct

content:
せいこう〔成功〕
〈名〉Success; achievement; victory; triumph:(=する)(人を主格にすれば) to succeed (in something); to be successful (in anything); to achieve success; to make a success of it:(事を主格にすれば) to succeed (with one); to be a success; to prove successful

content.content: 彼は成功した
He has succeeded―He has been successful―He has made a success of it―He has the world at his feet.
商売をして成功した
He has succeeded in business.
彼の事業が成功した
He has succeeded in his undertaking―His undertaking has succeeded with him.
僕の試みが成功した
I have succeeded in my attempt―My attempt has succeeded with me.
彼は人の失敗することが成功する
He succeeds in what others fail in―What fails with others succeeds with him.
今度の事業は成功した
The enterprise is a success―The enterprise has proved successful.
彼はきっと成功する
He is sure to succeed―He is certain to succeed―He will make a success of it.
今度はきっと成功してみせる
I am sure I shall succeed―I am sure of success―I will answer for my success.
今度は誓って成功する、成功しなかったら腹を切る
I will answer for my success with my life.
成功の見込があるか
Are there any chances of success?
成功の見込はどうか
How are the chances of success?
成功の見込が立った
The chances of success are in my favour.
成功の見込立たず
The chances of success are against me.
成功の見込充分だ、成功疑い無し
Success is certain―I am certain of success.
成功することは間違い無し
That I shall succeed, is certain.
彼は成功の見込充分だ
He is on the high road to success―He has the ball at his feet.
今度の商売はいよいよ成功しそうだ
My new business is in a fair way to succeed―It bids fair to succeed.
成功を祈る
I wish you may succeed―I wish you success―Success to you?―(祝盃を挙げて言えば)―Prosit!
成功を祝す
I congratulate you on your success―I wish you joy of your success.
成功を博す
to achieve a success―score a success
大成功
a great success―a signal success―an achievement―a triumph
彼は大成功を博した
He has achieved a signal success―achieved a triumph.
危ない成功だった
It was a bare success―a narrow squeak.
失敗がかえって成功の基となる
Failure is the way to success.
失敗を転じて成功にする
to turn failure into success―win victory from defeat
成功の秘訣
the secret of success
待つを知るこれ成功の秘訣
To know how to wait, is the secret of success.
彼は成功者だ
He is a successful man―a success.
一人の成功者の蔭には幾多の失敗者が潜んでいる
For one man who succeeds, there are hundreds who fail.
成功謝金
a recompense conditional on success

content: 〈以下特例〉

content.content: 計略がうまく成功した
The stratagem took.
君の名前で触れ込めば成功疑い無しだ
Your name is a sure card.
始め好ければ半ばの成功
A good beginning is half the battle―“Well begun is half done.”

content.content: 法律の制裁
legal sanction―punitive sanction―vindicatory sanction
誰でも法律の制裁を受ける
Everybody is amenable to the law―responsible to the law.
彼らには制裁を受くる法律無し
They are responsible to no law―amenable to no law.

〈名〉Certainty of success; chances of success［注意］“Chances”(見込)は成句、打消のほかは複数。

content.content: 成算があるか
Are there any chances of success?―Are you certain of success?―Are you sure of success?
成算あり
There are chances of success―I stand a chance of success―I am sure of success.
成算無し
There is no chance of success―I stand no chance of success―I am doubtful of success.
成算の無い試みは止した方が好い
You had better desist from an attempt that stands no chance of success―that offers no hope of success.

生産力

生産率

生産物

生産高

生産費

content:
せいし〔制止〕
〈名〉Restraint; check; curb; repression; prohibition; inhibition:(=する) to restrain (one's activity); to check (one's impetuosity); to curb (one's activity); to repress (one's anger); to prohibit, inhibit (one from doing anything); to keep back (the people)

content.content: 警官が群衆を制止した
The police kept back the crowd.
警官がいくら制止しても群衆が線を破った
The police could not restrain the crowd from breaking through the line.
警官の制止するのを聞かずに群衆は線を破った
The populace broke through the line in defiance of the prohibition of the police.
どんなことをしても彼の活動を制止することができぬ
Nothing can restrain his activity―check his activity―curb his activity.

〈名〉A permanent tooth

content:
せいし〔生死〕
〈名〉Life and death; life or death:(=の) vital; critical

content.content: 生死命あり
Life and death are decreed by Heaven.
生死に関する問題だ
It is a matter of life and death―a hanging matter.
こりゃ生死問題だ
Life or death now!
彼は生死の境にいる
He hangs between life and death―His life hangs in the balance―He stands on the brink of the river.
彼は生死不明だ
It is unknown whether he is alive or dead―His fate is unknown.
五名は生死不明
Five are still missing―not yet accounted for.
君と生死を共にする
I will share your fate.
皆生死を誓った
They all swore to share the same fate.
彼は生死を顧みぬ
He carries his life in his hands―makes nothing of dying.
彼は生死を顧みず危険を冒した
He braved dangers with his life in his hands.
生死の巷に出入する
to run into the jaws of death
彼は生死の巷に出入して活動した
He bestirred himself in the very jaws of death.

〈名〉
1. (=政府の政治)the affairs of state; public affairs; administration (of public affairs); government; statecraft

content.content: 政治を執る
to administer the affairs of state―assume ［take, hold］the reins of government―govern a country
政治を司る(宰相になる)
to assume the helm of state
彼は政治を司っている(宰相たり)
He is at the helm of state―at the head of affairs.
政治が届く
The country is well governed.
政治を誤る

He has a talent for administration.

despotic government―autocracy

共和政治
republicanism

content: 2. (=民間の政治)politics; political affairs

content.content: 君は政治に興味が有るか
Are you interested in politics?
政治に興味が無い
I am not interested in politics―(他動詞構文にすれば)―Politics does not interest me.
政治を談ずる
to talk politics―discourse on politics
政治に手を出す
to dabble in politics
彼は政治に関係している

僕は政治に関係しない
I do not meddle in politics―I stand clear of politics.

a demagogue
政治思想
political ideas
国家の政治思想を養う
to foster political ideas in the people
英国人は政治思想が発達している
The Englishman is a good politician.
米国人は生まれながらにして政治思想を持っている
The American is a born politician.
日本人は政治思想が発達しない
The Japanese is no politician.
政治熱

あの地方は政治熱が盛んだ
Politics run high in those parts.
政治運動

to agitate
政治運動屋

the political world―the political circles

a political question―a political issue
政治犯

content.content: 彼は政治家になった
He has become a politician―entered upon a political career.
僕は政治家になろうと思う
I am going to be a politician―I aspire to political honours―I am an aspirant to political honours.

〈形〉Formal; regular; due; proper:(=に) formally; regularly; properly; duly; in due form; in proper form

content.content: 正式の裁判を仰ぐ
to demand a regular trial―(英国にては)―put oneself on one's country
二人は正式に婚約をした仲だ
They are formally engaged to each other―engaged to each other in due form.
正式に結婚した仲だ

証書は正式に書いてある

正式の手続きをふむ

content:
せいしつ〔性質〕
〈名〉
1. (=人の性質)nature; disposition; temperament

content.content: 持って生まれた性質はしかたがない
One can not help one's nature.
持って生まれた性質は直らぬ
One can not change one's nature―“The leopard can not change his spots.”
同じ親から生まれても性質が違えば違うものだ
People born of the same parents will have different natures―differ in nature.
あの人の性質としてそんな卑劣なことはできぬ
It is not in his nature―not in him―to commit such baseness.
日本人の性質としてそんな屈辱は忍べぬ

荒い性質だ

He is of an enthusiastic temperament.
冷淡な性質だ

content: 2. (=物質の性質)a property

The chemist studies the properties of all substances.

content: 4. (=徳性)a quality

この悪口は名誉に関する性質のものでない

精神錯乱する

精神を修養する

怒りを制す

君は試験の成績が好い

彼は学校の成績はたいそう好い

平常の成績が好い

学校の成績は優等だ

成績が劣等だ

そんなぜいたくをしてはいかん

僕はぜいたくをせぬ

僕はそんなぜいたくはできぬ
I can not afford such extravagance―I can not afford such expensive luxuries―I can't afford it.
貧乏だからそんなぜいたくはできぬ
I am too poor to afford such extravagance―too poor to afford it.
三井や岩崎でもそんなぜいたくはできまい
Even the millionaires of the land could not afford such extravagance.
ぜいたくに暮らす
to lead a luxurious life―live in luxury―live in clover
食物のぜいたくする

ぜいたくな生活

彼は口がぜいたくだ

贅沢家だ
